Slowly the discar equipment begins to RATTLE and SHAKE. AN ENORMOUS SHADOW creeps towards us blotting out the hor a loud RUMBLE is heard. Suddenly we are covered in DARKNESS as the SHADOW engulfs Only the lonely image of our EARTH hangs in the air, unti huge silhouetted OBJECT suddenly blocks our view.

A lone TECHNICIAN works on his putting skills.  Behind hi wall to wall technical equipment quietly sifts through da A RED LIGHT begins to flash. The Technician turns and slowly walks towards the source. by one a series of LIGHTS turn on.  The Technician (TECH grabs a pair of headphones.  His eyes widen.
Sleepily a SUPERVISOR picks up the phone.
If this isn't an insanely beautiful woman, I'm hanging up.
Shut up and listen. He holds the phone up to a speaker, increases the volume. strange FLUCTUATING TONE plays out in sequential patterns
HEARING it, the Supervisor BOLTS UP, banging his head on bunk above him.
A pajama party on acid.  Five other technicians, in vario states of undress, hover anxiously around the main consol The Supervisor enters, tying his robe.
God, I hope it's not just another damned Russian spy job.
(overlapping)
Negative.  Computer affirms the  signal is unidentified.
(hanging up the phone)
The boy from Air Res Traffic say the  skies are clear.  No terrestrial launches.
It's the real thing.  A radio signal from another world. The room becomes quiet as they realize that after years o searching the heavens, they might have finally found something.
Let's not jump the gun.  Run a trajectory source computation. Tech Three slides over to another computer. SUPERVISOR (cont'd)
I want to know exactly where it's coming from.
This can't be right. Tech Three just stares at his screen in disbelief.
What's wrong?
Calculated distance from source is at three hundred and eight five thousand kilometers. (turning to Supervisor)
It's coming from the moon. The Supervisor reaches over and turns up the volume on th speaker.  As they listen to the strange TONES we...
Elevator doors OPENS revealing four star GENERAL GREY, Commander in Chief U.S. Space Command.  Understandably nervous, the COMMANDING OFFICER escorts him down the hall
Who else knows about this?
S.E.T.I. in New Mexico identified a signal but they're even more confused than we are. The General shoots him a disapproving glance.
Excuse me, Sir. He slides his security card through the lock and the door open.
Banks of computers, Technicians and assistants working feverishly through the night.  The Officers cross the roo Super:

Satellite reception has been impaired but we were able to get these. They arrive at a glass table.  The surrounding officers s to attention as a SECOND OFFICER quickly brings over a la transparency.  We SEE a grainy image of a large vague OBJ
Looks like a big turd. The two Officers exchange a glance.
We estimate it has a diameter of over five hundred and fifty kilometers and a mass roughly one fourth the size of our moon. The General turns to the Second Officer, concerned.
A meteor?
No Sir.  Definitely not.
How do you know?
Well, er... it's slowing down.
It's doing what?
It's... slowing down, Sir. The General walks over to a phone, picks it up.
Get me the Secretary of Defense. (pause)
Then wake him up.
Laying in bed THOMAS J. WHITMORE reads a stack of papers. phone RINGS.
(filtering through phone)
Hi. It's me. The warm look on Whitmore's face tells us everything abou he feels about the woman on the other end.
Hi honey.  What time is it there?
Dressed in a night gown, MRS. MARGARET WHITMORE unpacks h briefing papers lays them out on a small desk as she talk Through the window we SEE Los Angeles at night.
Two in the morning.  I  know
didn't wake you?
(filtered)
As a matter of fact you did.
(smiles)
Liar.
Whitmore sits up.
I have a confession to make. There's a beautiful young blonde sleeping next to me. Sleeping next to him, his six-year-old daughter, PATRICIA
(filtered)
You didn't let her stay up watching T.V. all night?
Of course not. The little girl stirs awake, looks up.
Mommy?
You're flying back right after the luncheon?  Okay, here she is. Whitmore hands her the phone and gets out of bed.  Habita he turns on the television.
Several "Pundits" sit around a MaLaughlin-type news discu program.  The picture quality is snowy, static ridden.
... the inexperience in public office was inevitably going to catch up with him.  He's scarified his ideals for "politics as usual." Whitmore ties on his robe as he adjusts the picture quali

...I said this during the campaign.  Leadership as a pilot in the Gulf War has no relationship to political leadership.  It's a different animal... Suddenly the channel changes.  A cartoon comes on.  Whitm turns to his daughter who holds he remote.
(into phone)
Daddy let me watch Letterman.
Traitor.
Whitmore exits the room.
As Whitmore steps out of his bedroom, a Security guard sn to attention.  Someone hidden behind a newspaper, sits on bench.
Good morning, Mr. President.
Good morning, George. The paper is dropped revealing CONSTANCE HALBROOK, mid- thirties, aggressive, sharp, the President's communicatio director.  Quickly she gathers her things and follows Whitmore.
Two servants are preparing breakfast as Whitmore and Cons enter.  Whitmore sits down, grabs a coffee.
You're up early this morning, Connie. She tosses him one of the many newspapers in her hands.
They're not attacking your policies, they're attacking your age. (another paper; reading)
"...addressing Congress, Whitmore seems less like the President and more like the orphan child Oliver asking, 'please sir, I'd like some more.'"
Clever.
Age was never an issue when you stuck to your gun.  You were thought of as young and idealistic.  But the message has gotten lost.  There's too much compromise, too much politics.
(pointedly)
Isn't it amazing how fast everyone can turn against you. Realizing she may be pushing him too far, she hands him another paper.
Well, the Orange County Register has named you one of the ten sexiest men of the year.
You see, substance at last. An AIDE appears at the doorway.
Excuse me, Mr. President.  It's the Secretary of Defense. Whitmore goes to the phone, picks it up.
Yes?  Say that again?

Drifting away from us the old Russian satellite becomes smaller and smaller.  We PAN with it as we SEE it's on a collision course with something huge. Suddenly the satellite EXPLODES on IMPACT with the much l object that dwarfs the puny piece of hardware.  As huge a is, we get the feeling we've only seen a portion of the t
A slow crane down from the Manhattan skyline, revealing..

With the New York skyline across the Hudson behind them, men sit in this small park playing chess.  Unlike the oth DAVID MARTIN is in his early thirties, sixties hippie mee nineties yuppie nerd. He concentrates intensely on his next move.  MOISHE. sixt smokes a cigar impatiently.
What are you waiting?  My social security will expire, you'll still be sitting there.
I'm thinking.
So think already. David makes a move.  Instantly Moishe counters his move. David furls his brow in thought.
Again he's thinking. Moishe reaches into a paper bag and retrieves a coffee in Styrofoam cup.
You have any idea how long it takes for those things to decompose?
You don't move soon.  I'll begin to decompose. Just as David finally makes his move, Moishe counters aga David shoots him a look and stares back down to the board MOISHE (cont'd)
David, I've been meaning to talk with you.  It's nice you've been spending so much time with me, but...
Dad, don't start.
I'm only saying, it's been what? Four years, you still haven't signed your divorce papers.
Three years.
Three, four.  Move on.  It's not healthy. Moishe takes a big puff on the cigar and coughs.
Look who's talking healthy. Suddenly David's beeper goes off.
How many times is that now?  You trying to get fired? David moves his queen.
Checkmate.  See you tomorrow, Dad. He gives his father a quick kiss and hurries away.
That's  not checkmate I can still... Oh. (yelling after him)
You could let an old man win once in a while, it wouldn't kill you.
David pedals his bike through mid-town Manhattan.  He arr at COMPACT CABLE SYSTEMS.
His bike hoisted on his shoulder, David squeezes through revolving doors. MARTY GILBERT, short, nervous and harrie comes rushing over.
What the hell is the point of having a beeper if you don't turn it on?
It was  turned on.  I was ignoring you.  What's the big emergency?

Started this morning.  Every channel is making like it's nineteen fifty.  Snow, static, all kinds of distortions.  No one knows what the hell is going on. David deposits his bike in the kitchenette as Marty tosse coke bottle in the trash.  David retrieves it.
Damn it, Marty.  There's a reason we have bins labeled "recycle." Finding more bottles in the trash, David turns to Marty accusingly.
What the hell is this?
So sue me. Before David can say anything, Marty ushers him out of th room.
Technicians are working feverishly.  Clearly every monito experiencing varying degrees of signal disruption.  David moves over to the main console.
Did you try to switch to transponder channels?
Please, would I be this panicked if it was that simple? David examines the readouts, puzzled.
Let's retrofit the dish to another satellite.
We've tried.  It's not working. It's almost as though they  weren't even there. David looks up, puzzled.
That's impossible.
Bad reception.  A hand SMOCKS the side of it.  No use.
Eleven-year-old TROY BRENNON tries to fix the television. His older brother MIGUEL, seventeen, cooks breakfast.
Stop it.
It's all fuzzy.
You're gonna break it.  Just leave it alone.  Here, take your medicine. Miguel sits a small bottle of medicine and a spoon down i front of Troy.  Troy pushes the bottle away.
I don't need it.
(pushing it back)
Just take it, dick head. (turning to his sister)

Alicia!  Make sure he takes his medicine. His sister, ALICIA, fourteen, hormones kicking in, testin boundaries, listens to her walkman while putting on too m makeup.  Miguel throws a dish towel to get her as Troy hi the television again.
A beat up pick-up truck comes down a dirt road and skids halt on the gravel next to the Brennon Mobile Home at thi small shabby countryside trailer park.  An angry FARMER j out, slamming his door.
Alicia opens the front door and smiles flirtatiously at t angry farmers, LUCAS, who marches over.  Miguel edges her of the doorway, wanting to handle this himself.
Morning, Lucas. Lucas holds a bowl full of rotted vegetables.
You like these!  I've got a whole goddamned crop full! Unceremoniously, he dumps them at Miguel's feet. LUCAS (cont'd)
Where the hell is your father? You know what time it is?
He had to re-fuel.  There musta been a problem.
We both know what the problem is. He's a damned nut case, is what he is.  I musta been out of my mind. Troy SMACKS the television again.
Troy, stop it!  I swear to God!
Miguel, if he's not in the air in twenty minutes, that's it.  I'm getting someone else. Lucas storms away.  Again, Troy whacks at the television.
Stop it, Troy!  I swear to God! Determined, Troy HITS the television again.  This time th picture goes out completely.

Rolling over us, the immense under-belly of this enormous craft obliterates our view.  A loud SCREECH.  Suddenly th bottom begins to SEGMENT. Dozens of large sections begins to DISENGAGE, extracting themselves, twisting away from the larger bilge. The separated SEGMENTS themselves are enormous.  Slowly t twist downwards on a collision course to the blue planet below... Earth.
Under a barrage of questions from her own staff, Constanc hurries down the corridor.
CNN is running a story that we're covering up some kind of nuclear testing experiments...
Tell them to run with it if they want to embarrass themselves.
NASA has been up my butt all morning.  They want to know our position.
Our official position is we don't have an official position.
Connie, what the hell  is going on? Constance escapes into the elevator, turns around.
(smiles confidently)
Come on, people.  Would I keep you guys out of the loop?
In a second!
Absolutely. Before she can retort, the elevator doors close.
The President, General Grey, the SECRETARY OF DEFENSE and White House Chief of Staff ALBERT NIMZIKI are gathered ar the couch.
At the moment, our satellites are somewhat unreliable.  Isn't it possible that thing may just pass us by?
What if it doesn't "pass us by?" Let's retarget some ICBMs to blow it out of the sky...
Forgive me, but with the little information we  do have, the only thing that would accomplish is turn one dangerous falling object into many. Just then the door opens and Constance enters.
What's the damage?
The press is making up their own stories at this point.
(to General Grey)
Get on the horn with Atlantic Command.  Let's upgrade the situation to DEFCON 3.
That's not your call to make, Mr. Nimziki.
Isn't that a little premature?
I don't think so.

We're two days away from the fourth  of July.  We have over fifty percent  of our armed forces on weekend leave,  not to mention the troops and  commanders we        have in town for the  Fourth of July        parade.  We call them  back now, we're sending up a major red  flag. They go quiet as Commanding Officer from Space Command da into the room.
Our intelligence tells us the object has settled into a stationary orbit.
Well that's good news.
Not really. He lays out the diagrams and photos on the table.  Everyo gathers around.
Part of it has broken off into nearly three dozen other pieces.
Pieces?
Smaller than the whole, yet over fifteen miles in width themselves.
Where are they heading?
They should be entering our atmosphere within the next twenty- five minutes. The room is silenced.  All eyes turn to the President who nothing.  Nimziki leans in close to him.
Like it or not, we're at DEFCON 3. Recall the troops and put them on yellow alert.
as an ALARM quickly BUZZES. David leans into frame and op the door to the microwave.  We WIDEN to reveal...
David retrieves his home-make cup-a-soup.  We SEE this cu clearly has the David touch; ecology posters, plants, ton computers and electronic gizmos.
Please, tell me you're getting something. Marty enters, looking over David's shoulder as he eats.
There's good news and bad news.
What's the bad news?
You're in meal penalty for disturbing my lunch.
And the good news is you won't charge me.
No.  The good news is I found the problem and it's not our equipment.  There's some weird signal embedded within the satellite feed.
That's the  good news? David slides over to another computer and turns on an intricate computation program.

Yes, because the analog signal has a definite sequential digital patterns embedded within it.  When I find the exact binary sequence and I apply a phase reversed signal to that calculated spectra analyzer I built you last Christmas, we should be able to block out the overlay completely...
...and we'll be the only guys in town with a clear picture?  That's my man.
Racing over back roads behind a long open field, Miguel r his beat-up motor bike, searching.  Looking up he SEES something in the air.
converted into a crop-duster, BUZZES overhead.  Spraying insecticide wildly, the plane zigzags over the field.
(yelling)

Russell!  God damn it, Russell! Looking down from the cockpit, RUSSELL BRENNON waves stup Shaggy blonde hair and two days' growth, Russell is the i of a fifty-one-year-old little boy. Miguel follows him below, screaming at him.  Russell, fly recklessly, looks down at Miguel not understanding.  By t time he looks back he SEES...

at the edge of the field, nearly on top of him.  In a tri move, Russell turns the plane on ITS SIDE, and SLICES thr the narrow gap between the trees. Miguel screams with delight at his prowess.  Miguel looks pissed.
Miguel races over, skidding to a halt next to the landed with plane.
Just what the hell do you think you're doing?
(climbing down)
I'm bringing home the bacon. Earning my keep.  And doing a fine job if I do say so myself.
It's the wrong field, you idiot! Lucas' farm is on the other side of town.
You sure?
Damn it, he was doing you a favor. You know how hard it is to find someone who doesn't think you're completely crazy? (MORE)

What are we supposed to do now? Huh?  Where are we supposed to go now? Pissed, Miguel peels away, kicking gravel back at Russell Pathetically, he reaches into his jacket and pulls out a bottle of Jack Daniels.  He takes a healthy swig.

A tent city.  Ubiquitous overcrowding and poverty.  Sever hundred refugees settle down for the night. Super:  Northern Desert, Iraq A BEDOUIN stokes a small fire besides his family's tent. Suddenly a group of shouting SCREAMING TRIBES PEOPLE come rushing past him. The Bedouin watches them with confusion.  Overcome with curiosity he goes against the tide of people, up the hill As the Bedouin reaches the top of the hillside, his mouth falls open, aghast as he SEES...
Creeping from across the horizon above the rocky mountain terrain, a wide
high in the sky, flaring and exploding.  A terrifying sight.
Super:  Battle Carrier, USS Eisenhower - Persian Gulf
A loud KLAXON ALARM is ringing out.  The FIRST LIEUTENANT comes rushing in.
Ensign, status?
We have a total radar black out over a thirteen kilometer area. The Lieutenant moves over to the main radar screen.  The entire upper portion of the screen is BLANK.  And the bla area is MOVING.
Have a complete diagnostic run...
Excuse me sir, radar may be malfunctioning but infrared is off the map! He diverts the Lieutenant's attention to another screen; BRIGHT SEA OF RED light bleeds off the map.
Get the CINC Atlantic Command on the line.
A technical OFFICER rips off a data sheet as it shoots ou the printer and rushes over to the Commanding Officer.
Sir, we now have visual range with incoming over Iraqi airspace.
A second sighting?
Yes Sir, this just came in from the Eisenhower. The Commanding Officer grabs a phone laying off the hook.
Correction, we have  two confirmed visual contacts.  One over Iraq, one over the Pacific.

The room is packed.  The President and his chief advisors there along with the Joint Chief of Staff.  Representativ from the Atlantic Command and U.S. Space Command have for small clusters around telephones.
Where in the Pacific? (turning to the President)
They've spotted one off the California coast line. Surrounded by the Secret Service, the President is speech Constance Halbrook comes rushing into the room and whispe the President.

Put it on. Constance moves over to a cabinet and turns on the T.V. ( reception is still fuzzy, picture "rolling").  The CNN Ne broadcast shows the phenomenon over Novosibirsk, Russia. There is mass hysteria behind the reporter.
(filtered)

...sightings of this atmospheric phenomenon have been reported here in Novosibirsk, Russia and other parts of Siberia.  Moving too slowly to be a comet or meteor, astronomers are baffled as to its origin... Everyone is locked onto the television, mesmerized. NEWSCASTERS (cont'd) (filtered)

...Widespread panic has gripped the countryside as thousands have taken to the streets and clogged the highways.  Hundreds have been injured... General Grey confers with the Atlantic command CINC.  He turns to the President and whispers.
Mr. President, we have an AWAC on the west coast.  E.T.A. with contact point, three minutes.
Wall to wall computer, radar and intelligence gathering equipment.  Technicians frantically try to adjust as the system goes hay wire.
(reporting into radio)
It's no use.  Side radar doesn't see a thing!
(reporting)
That's correct.  We're IMC blind, sir. We TRACK across them over to the pilots and into the cock Cloudy skies.  The PILOT squints out the window as he spe
Negative.  We still have  zero visibility.
ZOOMING overhead as we SEE the AWAC sailing through a thi cloudy sky. Super:  Pacific Coastline, California The AWAC disappears from view into the clouds.
The President and his top advisors are gathered around a speaker phone listening to the pilot of the AWAC.
(filtered)
Instrumentation is malfunctioning. We can't get any kind of reading on what's in front of us.
The Pilot squints as he tries to see through the clouds.
Wait a minute, it may be clearing. Suddenly the clouds part before us and we're face to face a
The speaker phone cracks and distorts.
(filtered)
Jesus God!  The sky's on fire!
The AWAC attempts to climb sharply as we get our first re look at the atmospheric phenomenon.  Majestic and monstro The AWAC is not going to be able to make it. Quickly it is ENGULFED in the flames.
The phone line goes dead.  General Grey spins to an AIDE.
Get them back on line.
(on other phone)
Line's gone, sir. The ATLANTIC COMMAND CINC, turns from a different phone.
Two more have been spotted over the Atlantic.  One is moving toward New York, the other is headed this direction.
How much time do we have?
Less than ten minutes.
(turning to aid)
Organize a military escort to Crystal Mountain.
(to President)
Sir, I strongly recommend we move you to a secured location immediately. ... The President hesitates, he turns to Constance.
Can we expect the same kid of panic here as in Russia?
More than likely.
Mr. President, you can discuss this on the way. Torn, the President grapples with a decision.  Finally...
I'm not leaving.
We must maintain a working government in a time of crisis...

I want the Vice President, Secretary of Defense, the whole Cabinet and the Joint Chiefs taken to a secured location. I'm staying here.  I am  not going to add to a public hysteria that could cost lives.
But, Mr. President...
So far these things have not become hostile.  For the moment let's assume they won't. (to Constance)

Connie, let's issue statements advising people not to panic, to stay home and take cover. Constance issues commands to her staff as they quickly exit along with most people in the room.  General Grey go over to the President.
With your permission, Mr. President, I'd like to remain my your side.
I had a feeling you would.
Sir, what happens if they  do become hostile?
Then God help us.
On the T.V. behind David, news footage of the phenomenon Russia plays silently.  Oblivious, David works his comput
(stopping in doorway)
David, are you watching this? David waves her away, deep in concentration.  Suddenly a computer BEEPS.  Excitedly David prints out his finding. grabs it and exits.
Engrossed in his printout, David walks past his co-worker are glued to the distorted picture on the television, wat the phenomenon.
Marty stares at his television watching General Grey addressing the press.  David enters, staring at his readi
I've got a lock on the signal pattern.  We  can filter it out.
(distracted)
Huh?  Oh, good, hood.
Strange thing is, if my calculations are right it'll be gone in approximately seven hours anyway.  The signal reduces itself every time it recycles. Eventually it will disappear.  Are you listening?
(still glued to T.V.)
Can you believe this?
What re you talking about?
Haven't you been watching? David turns for the first time to the television and sees phenomenon.  Constance comes on addressing the press.
(filtered)
...so far the phenomenon has not caused any damage.  In all likelihood it won't...
More reporters rush in from the back quickly setting up a this hastily called press conference continues.
...everyone should remain calm. Take cover where you can but the important thing is not to panic.
Miguel, Alicia and Troy watch the static riddled T.V.
(filtered) ...we have a fix on three
different occurrences about to appear over American cities.  One is headed toward Los Angeles...
(filtered)
...the other two are on our Eastern seaboard headed towards New York and Washington, D.C... Suddenly hectic CO-WORKER #2 appear at the door.
Jamie says this building has an old bomb shelter.  We're heading down there now.
(dry; to David)
Feel no shame in hiding.
A crowd of people head down the hall for the shelter whil others stay glued to the set.  There is a mix of fascinat and panic.  David watches the commotion, dumb struck.
Oh shit, I better call my wife.
Depressed Russell nurses a beer at the counter.  Three FL MECHANICS walk in, having a good laugh.  One of them spot Russell and moves over to him.
Hey, Russ, heard you had a little trouble this morning.  Dusted the wrong field? The Mechanics laugh.  Russell tries to ignore them.
I know, you're probably still a little confused from your hostage experience.
Hostage experience?  Something happen to you, Russ?
He ain't never told you!?  Seems years back our boy here had been kidnapped by aliens.  Did all kinds of experiments on him and such.  Tell him, Russ.
Not today, guys.  Okay. Russell gets up and heads for the door.
You just gotta get a couple more beers in him, he'll tell you all about it.  Crazy stuff.  Won't you, Russ?
The Mechanic follows Russell outside, his buddies in tow.

Hey, Russ, when they took you up in their space ship, they do any sexual things to you? The mechanics crack up laughing.  Suddenly the things aro them begin to RUMBLE.  The SHADOW engulfs them, silencing Mechanics. Panicked they turn and RUN AWAY.  Russell just looks up a sky, grabs his Jack Daniels and takes another swig.
Dogs bark and people stumble out of their trailers as an enormous SHADOW creeps over them.
The windows grow DARK and the room begins to RUMBLE.  Mig rushes to the door, ushering his siblings out.
Alicia and Troy step out the door, stopping dead in their tracks.  Miguel follows them only to look up and SEE...
The flames are burning out, replaced by huge plumes of da smoke billowing around the edges of the phenomena.  Only traces of extinguishing flames illuminate it.
David pushes past the people making their way down, fight against the tide.  Another CO-WORKER (#3) stops halfway.
Aren't you coming, David?
No way, I've got to  see this.
Frightened tourists run for cover as the colossal SHADOW approaches.  Reflected in the water below we SEE the fier apparition transfigure into the dark foreboding clouds.
The SHADOW writhes up the detailed statue of Lincoln, devouring him completely until we are left in total darkn
People are being evacuated from their offices.  Patricia, President's daughter, breaks away from her nanny.
The President talks on the phone.  Constance waits nearby
(into phone)
Of course, Russia and the United States are in this together.  Yes, Mr. President, you have my word. Yes, Das Vedanya. The President hangs up.
What is their position?
I think he was drunk. Patricia bursts through the door and runs into her father arms, terrified.  A SECRET SERVICE man appears.
Mr. President, we have to go. Abruptly, the room DARKENS as it begins to RUMBLE.
The long, dark SHADOW moves across the entire White House engulfing it in darkness.
In the distance we SEE the mutated phenomenon's dark gray clouds nearing Miss. Liberty.  As it approaches we SEE th York skyline begin to darken.

location: BLACK TOP BASKET BALL COURT, NEW YORK

text: Kids playing basket ball.  A young BOY stops playing, sta skyward.  One by one, they all look upwards, stunned as a dark SHADOW creeps over them. With a loud CRASH, several New York Cabs SLAM into one an in the street.  Two more cars crash into them.  A pile up ensues.
Foot traffic stops as the long SHADOW crawls over the ent area.
Large satellite dishes beset a doorway to the roof which open.  David steps out just as a long, dark SHADOW covers him, sending the city into darkness.  David looks up to S

Protruding through the dark clouds we get a glimpse of th underbelly of a colossal ALIEN CRAFT, its outer veneer of smoke and clouds beginning to fade away. Below we see PANIC, cabs SLAMMING into one another, peopl staring, people screaming.  No one knows how to react. David runs to the other side of the rooftop, overlooking Central Park, to get a better look.
The entire park is plunged into darkness as the craft abo blots out of the sun.  Amazing as it may seem, the hoveri BLANKETS THE ENTIRE PARK and BEYOND.  We still have NOT s an entire craft .
(realizing)
My God.  The signal.
A panoramic view of the Los Angeles basin.  Slowly fillin screen, we SEE a portion of the enormous space craft as i creeps towards the city, obliterating our view.
A station wagon, filled with kids and a harried HOUSEWIFE comes to a stop.  The passenger door opens and a young si year-old boy, DYLAN steps out.

Dylan, tell your mom you can stay overnight again Thursday. Suddenly a car SAILS over a nearby hill in front of them, hitting the ground with a BANG.  Two more cars follows, a bound.  As the Housewife turns she SEES...
Rising over the mountain we SEE the Space Ship as it near city, blocking out the sunshine. Panicked, the Housewife hits the gas and peels out, leavi confused Dylan staring skyward.
Two people sleep as Dylan runs into the room.
Mommy, look at! He rushes away.  The SHADOW moves past the window, darken the room.  His mother, JASMINE DUBROW, stirs.
(re: darkness)
It's too early, baby. She turns back over.  Suddenly the room briefly RUMBLES.
Earthquake?
Not even a four pointer.  Go back to sleep. Shrugging, the man does.
In Los Angeles.  The SHADOW slowly covers the sign.

The President and his daughter cautiously approach the wi staring in awe at the amazing sight above them.  Several others approach from behind. Cautiously some people begin to walk outside, staring up the leviathan, mouths agape.
Slowly staff members approach, gazing out the window. Constance steps up behind the President.
What do we do now?
Address the nation.  There are a lot of very frightened people out there right now.
Yeah.  I'm one of them.
All of Washington is under the shadow of this gargantuan craft.  A stunning tableau.
The man sleeping next to Jasmine's beagle BOOMER drops Steven's tennis shoes on top of him, waking him.
He's trying to impress you.
He's doing a good job. He pats the dog on the head and takes the shoes.  Steven up and makes his way to the bathroom.
As Steve takes a pee, he SEES out the window a family pac up their car, others standing around staring at something the distance.  A HELICOPTER flies overhead.
Neighbors are moving.  I think they're tired of earthquakes. He finished and flushes.
Steve enters the living room.  The television is playing news broadcast.
...with little damage reported to the southland area.  People are advised not to panic...
Hon, something's on the table 'bout the quake. Jasmine sits up in bed, yelling out to Steve.
Dylan out there? Steve turns, looking for Dylan when the doggie door pops and Dylan crawls through.
What have you been up to, Sport?
(holding his gun)
Shooting aliens. Steve musses up the boy's hair, smiling.
(entering)
Coffee? Steve mumbles an affirmative as he exits.
Steve picks up the morning paper and opens it.  He doesn' notice the DOZENS of neighbors quickly packing up and rus to get away as he reads the paper oblivious.
You want milk with your coffee? Jasmine appears behind him, her view, too, obscured by th open newspaper.  Suddenly another HELICOPTER room overhea Annoyed, Steve lowers his paper.
As the paper is lowered we SEE the helicopter SWOOP down. it flies away we SEE...
Covering all of Los Angeles.  This is the first time we s the entire craft.  It is stupendous.  Steve's jaw hits th floor.  The milk goes CRASHING as Jasmine SCREAMS.
Running for all he's worth, David sprints down the stairs
Dashing off the stairs, David stops seeing that the room now completely empty.  The wall of monitors play for no o David walks up to one, adjusting the volume.
A space ship logo spins next to the words VISITORS: CONTA CRISIS.  Wolf Blitzer comes on screen live from the Penta
Pentagon officials are reporting more ships have just arrived over the capitals of India, England and Germany. As he speaks we get quick glimpses of the other ships.
I know, babycakes.  Calm down. David spins around at the sound of the voice but the room still empty.  David leans down and looks under a desk whe finds Marty still on the phone with his wife.
Tell her to get the kids and leave town.
What happened?
(yells)
Just do it! Marty realizes David is dead serious.
Babycakes, pack the kids up and take them to your mother's.  Don't ask.  Go. Mary hangs up, crawls out from under the table. MARTY (cont'd)
Okay, why did I just send my family to Atlanta?
Remember I told you that the signal hidden within our satellite signal is slowly recycling down to extinction.
Not really...
That signal.  It's a  countdown .
(confused)
A countdown to what?
Think.  It's like in chess.  First you strategically position your pieces.  Then, when the timing's right.  You strike. David motions to the television.
...there are additional unconfirmed sightings over Japan, the Mediterranean, and China...
They are positioning themselves all over the world and using this one signal to synchronize their efforts.  In approximately six hours the signal will disappear and the countdown will be over.
Then what?
Checkmate. Marty takes a beat to digest.  Then, grabbing the phone..

I gotta call my brother, my bookie, my lawyer... fuck my lawyer... David also grabs a phone.  Suddenly the bank of monitors synchronize into  one enormous image across the entire video wall; the President addressing the nation.
The President stands at the podium giving his address.
My fellow Americans, a historic and unprecedented event has taken place.  The question as to whether or not we are alone in the universe has been answered...
As Constance watches the President, she unconsciously mou the words of his speech, after all, she did write them. PRESS AIDE tugs on her sleeve.  She tries to wave her off
He says he's your husband. Her expression drops.  She takes the phone from her.
What do you want?
(filtered)
You have to leave the White House.
This is not the time or the place to have this same old discussion.
You don't understand.  You have to leave  Washington .
Impatient, Constance tries to get off the phone.
In case you haven't noticed, we're in a little bit of a crisis here.
(filtered)
I've worked with embedded loading. They're communicating with a hidden signal.  They're going to attack...
You're being paranoid.
(filtered)
It's not paranoia.  The embedding is very subtle.  It's probably been overlooked... Constance hangs up.  Her face betrays mixed emotions.
David stares at the phone, pissed.  Something on T.V. catches his attention.  Through the snowy image he SEES..
(filtered)
...My staff and I are remaining here at the White House while we attempt to establish communication... Hanging up the phone, David sprints for the exit. PRESIDENT WHITMORE (cont'd)
...so remain calm.  If you are compelled to leave these cities, please do so in a safe and orderly fashion.
The rush to get away creeps slowly as cars jam the street total grid-lock.  David pedals his bike furiously through traffic.
The mass exodus has reached the bridge.  Total congestion David fights his way through.
The New York skyline behind him across the Hudson, David off his bike, and races towards a row of tract houses.
David BANGS on the door.  It flies open.  Moishe is holdi hunting rifle, pointing it at David.
Pops!
The television said they've started with the looting already Vultures.
You still got the Olds?
You want to borrow the car?  You don't have a license.
That's okay.  You're driving.
Steve, wearing his Marine flight officer uniform, shoves last of his things into his duffel bag.  We notice there small figurines of dolphins everywhere.  Jasmine hovers nervously behind him.
You can't go.  Call them back.
Baby, you know how it is.  I have to report to El Toro right away.
You said you were on leave for the Fourth.
They cancelled it.  Why are you acting like this? Jasmine grabs the blinds and yanks them away.  We SEE the alien craft through the window.
Why?  That's why.  That thing scares the piss out of me.
Dylan sits behind the wheel pretending to drive.  Steve g him, pulling him out.  He reaches into his duffel, grabs brown paper bag.
Here.  I got these for you.  Be careful with them. Dylan opens the bag; fireworks.  Jasmine walks over.
Cool. Steve tosses his gear into the back, opens his door.
Wait.  I have to tell you something.
What?
(loses her nerve)
Be careful.
Look, after your shift tonight, why don't you grab Dylan and come stay with me on base.
Really?  You don't mind?
(smiling)
Naw.  I'll just tell my other girlfriends they can't come over tonight. Pissed, she hits him.  He loves it.
You know, you're not as charming as you think you are.
Yes, I am.
Dick-weed!
Butt-munch. They kiss.  Steve hops into his car and peels out.  Jasmi takes the bag from Dylan.
I'll take these.
Mommmmmm...
A perfectly preserved '68 Olds drives cautiously down the highway.  Around him we see other cars packed to the gill they make their escape from New York.
Not the most confident driver, Moishe holds the steering close to his chest.
It's the White House, for crying out loud.  You can't just drive up and ring the bell.
Can't this thing go any faster?
You think they don't know what you know?  Believe me, they know.  She works for the President.  They know everything.
They don't know this.
And you're going to educate them? Tell me something, you're so smart how come you spent eight years at M.I.T. to become a cable repairman?
Dad...
All I'm saying is they've got people who handle these things, David.  They want HBO, they'll call you.
Mrs. Whitmore is at a house phone.  Behind her we see sev news crews waiting for interviews.
(filtered through phone)
I want you out of there.
You're staying there to keep people calm.  It's the right thing to do.  I'm not going to let them criticize you for it.
The President sits on his bed, his daughter lays next to watching T.V.  The signal distortion is getting worse.
Okay, fine but the second your interviews are done, I have a helicopter ready to take you to Nellis Air Force...
(filtered)
How's the munchkin?
She's glued to the T.V., just like the rest of the world.  I love you too.  Here she is... He hands Patty the phone as General Grey and Nimziki appe the doorway.  The President walks over to them.
More ships keep arriving, fifteen in total so far.
This is crazy.  We're loosing our first strike capabilities!
We're trying to communicate with them on all frequencies but we're getting nowhere.  Atlantic Command is working on a type of visual communication.
What the hell are they up to?

A long crowded highway of people trying to escape from Lo Angeles can be seen in the distance.  The huge space craf hovering behind them. Miguel is on the roof of the trailer, adjusting the T.V. antenna trying to get a picture.  Suddenly the image clea and we SEE a group of people in a crowded hallway.
(filtered)
...a local crop duster was arrested today attempting to land at Edwards Air Force Base... On the T.V. we SEE Russell being escorted to a police car Mortified, Miguel can't believe what he's seeing.

They've got to do something. I was abducted by space aliens ten years ago.  They did all kinds of experiments on me.  They've been studying us for years, learning our weakness.  We've go to do something before they kill us all!
Just as Troy starts to climb up, Miguel changes the chann Mrs. Whitmore.  Troy sits down next to Miguel.
(filtered)
...we need to remain calm.  As more people decide to leave the cities, safety is key...
Troy, you remember Uncle Hector, from Tucson?
He's got that SEGA Saturn CD, 64 bit, right?
Yeah.  What would you think if we went there to live for a while?
That'd be cool! Miguel thinks for a second, makes a decision.
Pack up, we're going. Miguel jumps down from the roof.  Troy climbs down the la
(yelling after him)
What about Dad?
Kissing.  It's getting hot.  Alicia laughs, pushes him aw
This could be our last night on Earth.  You don't want to die a virgin, do you?
What makes you think I'm a virgin? The Older Boy is taken off guard.  Before he can answer t tarp they were hiding under is ripped away.  Miguel stand there.
Come on, we're going.
I'm not going anywhere... Miguel grabs her by the wrist and pulls her away.
We see the long highway leading to Washington, the space hovering above it.  One side of the freeway is packed sol the other completely empty, save for one car...
Moishe looks to the other side of the freeway, jam packed his side, they are the only car for miles.

The whole world is trying to get out of Washington and we're the only schmucks trying to get in. As Moishe drives, David distracts him as he unpacks his backpack unloading his laptop.  He grabs a CD. MOISHE (cont'd)
What the hell is that?
This, pops, is every phone book in America.
You think an important person like Constance is going to be listed?
She always keeps her portable phone listed, for emergencies. Sometimes it's just her first initial, sometime her nickname... David starts to look it up.  Suddenly...

head_text.subj: DOZENS OF CARS HEADING STRAIGHT FOR THEM

text: In the attempt to get out, hundreds of cars have been re- directed by the military to use the opposite side of the highway.

Oh my God! Moishe SWERVES violently to avoid collision, barely missi the oncoming traffic.  Dodging right to left, Moishe hang for dear life. A Military Office, assisting in diverting the cars turns in time to see the Olds whiz by. David and Moishe are bounded around the inside of the car Moishe tries to veer through traffic. Suddenly A TRUCK  blocks off their only escape route. Moishe turns HARD and drives up onto the right shoulder.
The Olds is the only car in headed that direction.  Using shoulder, swerving to miss barricades, they drives off an ramp.
Nice driving, pops! Dangerously close to a heart attack, Moishe is, for once, loss for words.  Over their adrenaline pumped faces...
...put your hands together for Sabrina!
A bikini-clad Sabrina twirls gracefully on the stage.  As comes to a stop we reveal Sabrina is actually Jasmine.  S looks out into the audience and her expression DROPS.
Five strippers and eight customers.  All crowded near the television watching the news.
Helicopter footage of people gathered on the rooftops of downtown Los Angeles holding up drawings of space aliens.
(filtered)
...from the "it could only happen in California" file, hundreds of UFO fanatics have gathered on the rooftops of downtown Los Angeles, welcoming the new arrivals...
Jasmine storms into the dressing room.  Wiping off her ma she sits down next to TIFFANY who watches the same report small b&w.
I can't believe I even came in tonight.  What was I thinking?
(re: T.V.)
Isn't this cool?  And you thought I was nuts.  Oh, look, I brought mine with me. Tiffany holds up a drawing of a space alien.
You're not thinking of joining those idiots?
I'm going over there soon as I'm off.  Wanna come? Jasmine turns to Tiffany, dead serious.
Tiffany, I don't want you to go up there.  Promise me you won't. (Tiffany pouts)
Promise!
I promise.
Okay.  I'm gone.  I'm outta town for a while. Her boss MARIO enters and walks over to his private offic back.  He opens the door and finds Dylan playing with his Boomer.
What the hell's your kid doing here? Jasmine rushes past picking up Dylan and carrying him awa she heads for the exit.  Boomer follows.
You try to find a sitter today.
Where do you think you're going? You leave, you're fired.
(out the door)
Nice working with you, Mario.
The streets are nearly deserted.  Millions of small light the underbelly of the craft cast strange reflections on t streets below.  The Olds drives on its way towards the Ca building.
David types frustratedly on his laptop.
Not listed, huh?
I just haven't found it yet.  I tried C. Halbrook, Connie Halbrook, Spunky Halbrook...
Spunky?
College nickname.
You try Martin?
She didn't take my name when we were married. Moishe shrugs.  David gives it a shot.  Finds it.  The ma BEEPS.
(sarcastic)
So what do I know?
A crowded locker room.  Steve enters.
Where the hell've you been?
Ah, were you guys waiting for me? Several Marines throws towels at Steve as he makes his wa his locker.  His best friend, JIMMY, sits next to him.
Can you believe it?  This is serious shit, Stevie.  They've recalled  everyone
As Steve sits he SEES some envelops stuck into the side o locker.
Well, the mail's still working. He flips through the envelops and FREEZES when he sees on with the NASA insignia on it.  Jimmy snatches it away fro him.
Junk mail.  You don't want this. Steve quickly snatches it back, right it open and reads. the disappointment on his face we can tell it's bad news. Realizing, Jimmy puts a hand on Steve's shoulder.
I don't believe it.  They make you learn how to fly everything from an Apache to a Harrier and still they turn you down?  What else do they want you to learn?

How to kiss ass. Steve crumples at the letter and tosses it.  Angrily he o locker.  Pasted on the locker door we see photos of Jasmi next to the photos of the space shuttle, Apollo Missions, NASA insignia bumper sticker. As Steve stuffs his jacket into the locker, something fal out.  Before Steve can grab it, Jimmy snatches it up firs
(embarrassed)
Jasmine has this thing for dolphins.  I had them make it...
I thought you said you were doing to break it off. Steve snatches it back, embarrassed. JIMMY (cont'd)
Steve, listen to me, you're never gonna get to fly the space shuttle if you marry a stripper. Steve knows he's right.  He's torn.

The Olds stops near the White House.  From here we can SE tanks and armed patrols.  A small group of protesters hav gathered, upset about the military hardware.  Signs: "Don provoke" "Violence begets Violence."
David adjusts a small portable satellite, connecting it t phon and laptop computer.
So, you want to ring the bell or  should I? David flips open the phone, dials the number on the scree
Perfect, she's using it.
It's perfect the line is busy?
Yes.  I can use he signal to triangulate her exact position in the White House.
You can do that? Shooting his father a look.
(sarcastic)
All cable repairmen can.
Constance is just finishing a call on her cellular phone.
...Sally, take my cat with when you leave.  No I'm staying here at the White House.  Take care. The moment she hangs up, it RINGS.  Surprised, she answer
What?
(filtered)
Connie, don't hang up.
David?  How'd you get this number?
Walk to the window.  Right in front of you. Constance looks up to the large glass windows.  She walks to it, looking out.
What am I looking for?
Between two of the tanks outside, Constance can SEE David standing on top of the Olds across the street.  Moishe st out, waves.  Constance is stunned.
(to herself)
How does he do that?

Sulking, Alicia sits in back with he walkman on.  Troy sl while Miguel drives.  Suddenly Miguel his the brakes, as something comes SAILING DOWN FROM THE SKY. We realize it's the B-WING PLANE landing on the stretch o roadway directly in front of them.
The plane lands, skids into a turn.  Russell jumps out, w over to the trailer.  We can tell he's drunk again.
They let you out?
Just what the hell do you think you're doing? Miguel moves to meet Russell away from the trailer, not wanting the others to hear.
We're leaving, don't try and stop us.
You're not going anywhere.  You hear me?  I'm still your father. Miguel explodes, this has been building up for some time.
No, you're not!  You're just the man who married my mother.  You're nothing to me! Russell is momentarily silent, stunned.  Recovering...
Troy's still my son no matter how you feel about me.

For once in your life think about what's best for Troy.  Who has to beg for money to buy him medicine when you screw up?  Who? Suddenly we hear glass CRASHING.  Both men spin to find T standing behind them.

Stop it!  I'm not a baby!  I don't need your stupid medicine.  I don't need anyone to take care of me! Miguel leans down to see the broken MEDICINE BOTTLE on th floor.  Miguel rushes over to him, furious.

You know what this stuff costs? Do you want to get sick again!? Do you!? Frustrated, Miguel shoves Troy aside and heads back into trailer.  Wobbly from the drinking, Russell stands there pathetically, watching.

A large group of press rush over toward FOUR APACHE HELICOPTERS, each refitted with a large LIGHT BOARDS, as slowly lift off the ground.  Cameras flash, reporters yel questions to the Officers assigned to keep them at bay. Several news organizations do stand up remotes.  We TRACK them to the CNN crew.
What you see behind me are four Apache helicopters...
On the television plays the CNN broadcast.  The reception intermittently disrupted.
(filtered through T.V.)

...each has been refitted with what Pentagon officially hope will be our first step in communicating with the alien craft... We WIDEN to reveal a large contingent of military personn along with the President's chief advisors gathered around several monitors, (the center monitors are momentarily bl Suddenly everyone snaps to attention as the President ent
Where are we?
They're in the air.
Moishe inspects a photo of Constance with the President, impressed he nods with approval.
(to himself)
Very nice. Constance is looking at David's laptop displaying the breakdown of the alien signal.
And when is the countdown supposed to expire?
(checking)
Fifty six minutes, forty five seconds. Constance runs her fingers through her hair, exasperated. Moishe turns, listens.
What do you want me to do?
I want you to leave with us. Right now.
I can't leave.  We have to tell this to the President.
He's not going to listen to me. Surprised at his son, Moishe steps forward.
Sure he'll listen.  Why wouldn't he?
Because last time I saw him I punched him in the face.
You punched the President in the face?
He wasn't the President then.
David thought I was having an affair, which I  wasn't .
Punched the President?  Oh my god.
ZOOM by overhead.  In the distance we see they are headed the enormous alien craft.
The PILOT adjusts his radio.
Echo one, we are closing in.
The choppers alter their formation, aligning themselves alongside one another.  As the helicopters near the craft see how tiny they appear against the gargantuan space shi
The elevator doors open and Moishe steps out, overwhelmed impressed.  Constance leads them down the hall.  Moishe t to David, whispers.
If I had known I was going to meet the President, I'd a worn a tie. Look at me, I look like a  schlemiel.
The Office is empty as the trio walks in.  Moishe can't believe he's in there.  He straightens himself up, combs hair.
Wait here.  I'll be right back. David sets up his laptop.
Not on his desk.
The middle monitors are now on.  They show the night visi P.O.V. of the helicopters as they approach.  On the side monitors we SEE the various news broadcast of this event.
(filtered)

...the helicopters are making their final approach... On the middle monitor, through the night vision camera on lead helicopter we SEE the side of the craft as the helicopters near. Everyone in the room watches, tense. Constance enters and kneels down next to the President, whispering in his ear.  The President gets up and follows Constance.  Chief of Staff Nimziki objects.
You're leaving  now
The President silences him with a look.  As they exit.
I don't know how you put up with him.
He used to run the NASA.  He knows where all the bones are buried. Comes in handy.
I'll bet.
The door flies open and Constance and the President enter The moment President Whitmore sees David, he freezes.
What the hell's he doing here? Moishe, bursting, steps forward.
Moishe Martinsburg, Mr. President.
My ex-husband works in satellite communications.
I don't have time for this... With a BANG, David suddenly KNOCKS everything off the President's desk and starts to draw on the ink blotter.
It's about "Line o sight," Mr. President... David draws a circle representing Earth and a smaller cir just away from it.  The President reluctantly nears.

...If you wanted t coordinate with ships all over the world, you couldn't send one signal to every place at the same time.  That's called line of sight... Drawing a line from the ship of either side of the Earth, SEE that you could not send a signal to the other side. DAVID (cont'd)
...you'd need to relay your signal using satellites... David draws small satellites surrounding Earth. DAVID (cont'd)
...to reach each ship.  I have found a signal hidden inside our own satellite network. Suddenly an aide, ALEX, appears in the doorway.

Excuse me, Mr. President.  They're starting. The President turns to the monitor in his office.  We SEE helicopters turning on the light boards affixed to the fr of their cockpits.  He turns back to David.
Mr. President, they are using our own satellites against us and the clock is ticking.
The large light panels TURN ON, multi-colored lights slow begins to flash in a repeating sequential patterns.
The helicopters are puny little specs next to this Goliat The light boards continues to FLASH but there is no react from the ship.
Everyone is glued to the monitors as the President storms
General Grey, co-ordinate with Atlantic Command.  Tell them they have twenty five minutes to get as many people out of the cities as they can.
But Mr. President...
And get those helicopters away from the ship.  Call them back immediately. General Grey obeys, turning to an assistant who quickly g a phone.  Nimziki steps up to the President.
What the hell's going on?
We're leaving. An AIDE motions to the monitors.
They're responding. The room goes silent, everyone turns to the monitors.
On all screens we SEE the space ship as a long thin line WHITE LIGHT suddenly emits from the side of the craft, illuminating the four Apache Helicopters.

The light boards are overpowered by the bright light comi from the space craft.  Suddenly with a loud SCREECHING NO the white light spills out as the huge OPENING unfolds at side of the craft. The four helicopters have to flight to hold their positio something powerful emits from the schism in the ship. Then like a gigantic bug-zapper, the four pesky little Ap Helicopters are BLOWN OUT OF THE SKY, one by one.  They l no time to retreat.
Mrs. Whitmore packs her bag, as the horrifying image of t destruction of the helicopter replays on the T.V.
Mrs. Whitmore?  The President has ordered the evacuation.  We have to leave, now. She slams her valise SHUT and quickly exits.
SOARS over us, headed directly for downtown Los Angeles.
The UFO true believers are still there, holding up their signs.  Making her way through several of them we see  Tiffany . She looks up to the spacecraft above.
(awed)
It's beautiful. She digs her drawing of an alien out of her purse as she excitedly rushes up to the others.  She holds it up to th sky, proudly.
From out of nowhere the helicopter LIFTS up over the side the building, shining its spotlight down the believers below.
...we are evacuating the city. Please leave the building at once. The sign holders begin to "boo" the police, ignoring them
The freeway is packed on both sides, every car headed out town.  There is no opposing traffic.
Dylan holds Boomers as Jasmine drives.  The news plays ov car radio.
...authorities have called for a complete evacuation of Los Angeles County.  People are advised to avoid the highways whenever possible.
Now he tells me.

The President stops on his way to the Presidential helico as an aide brings his daughter outside.  The President us her into the helicopter.  He turns back and see a militar guard holding back Moishe and David.
They're okay.  Let them on!
The President steps inside, turns to General Grey.
Is my wife in the air?
She should be shortly. David flips open his laptop which reads: 09:07. 09:96...
The Presidential helicopter lifts off as several other helicopters wait behind, people filing into them.

The Police helicopter is still flashing their lights at t UFO believers who refuse to budge.  Suddenly the entire rooftop is BATHED IN WHITE LIGHT.  They all grow silent staring up at the craft. Above them another SCHISM has opened at the bottom of the craft, the white light spilling out. As though the heavens had opened, the UFO believers lift arms, waiting to be taken.
Take me!  No, take me!  Take me! Slowly, this beam of light from the base of the ship INTENSIFIES directly on the top of this building.
Standing on this rooftop heliport directly across from th believers, the First Lady watches them, concerned.
(yelling over helicopter)
Mrs. Whitmore! Reluctantly, the First Lady turns and runs for the helico The door is shut and the helicopter takes off.
With a ROAR, the Presidential helicopter ZOOMS past, behi we see an enormous SCHISM opening  beneath the space craft.
Alex is helping people get onto the remaining helicopters Suddenly he is bathed in WHITE LIGHT.  He looks up and se the SCHISM, its WHITE BEAM coming directly down upon the House.
The pinnacle of this landmark is abruptly illuminated in LIGHT.  We PAN UP to the space craft above, the beam intensifying from the SCHISM below the ship.
The Presidential helicopter lands.  The President and his group are ushered over to AIR FORCE ONE which stands only hundred yard away.
The door OPENS and the President and his advisors rush in David flops down into a seat, quickly flips open his lapt which reads: 00:05, 00:04...

As the light amplifies, the believers chant, louder and louder.  Suddenly the white light DISAPPEARS.  The believ are stunned.  In a brief moment it is replaced with a BLA A DESTRUCTION BEAM BLASTS down onto the rooftop, splinter everything there, Police helicopter included, into a bill tiny particles. Tiffany is he epicenter, from here the WALL OF DESTRUCTIO outwardly, destroying everything in its path.
Just as the BLAST HITS, the historic building is DECIMATE
Alex shuts the door on a helicopter.  As he steps back th white light VANISHES.  He looks up as the BLAST replaces beam.
Just as one of the helicopters pass us, the White House SPLINTERS BEFORE OUR EYES.
Air Force One quickly taxis down the runway toward us. Behind them in the distance we can SEE the DESTRUCTIVE be GROWING OUTWARDLY from the epicenter.
The WALL OF DESTRUCTION reaches the Capitol Building, fragmenting into a trillion particles.
Washed under the WALL OF DESTRUCTION, the Pentagon, too, blown to smithereens.
Thick with tension.  Everyone is white-knuckled, anxious take off as they taxi quicky down the runway.

Air Force one, full throttle.  It LIFTS OFF just in time miss the WALL OF DESTRUCTION as it rips apart the airport behind them, dangerously close. WIDE ANGLES - WASHINGTON, D.C. We SEE the WAVE OF DESTRUCTION growing outwardly from the epicenter, ENGULFING ALL OF WASHINGTON. Air Force One is just barely making it out in time.
Jasmine's car is caught in traffic just outside the tunne underpass at the Griffith Park Mountains.
(filtered)
...My God.  It's destroying everything in its path. Widening... Suddenly the radio CUTS OUT.  Jasmine turns around and SE

Far off the devastation of downtown can be seen.  The WAL DESTRUCTION growing towards us. Reacting, Jasmine grabs Dylan and dashes out of the car. Boomer follows.  Every drivers who can, jumps out of thei cars, running in all directions. Jasmine heads for the tunnel.
The grid-locked cars have nowhere to run as the WALL OF DESTRUCTION grows out from downtown.  All the cars are WI OUT in a row, sitting ducks.
Packed with cars.  They're quickly demolished as the WALL DESTRUCTION blasts by.
Jasmine turns back from the tunnel entrance.

Ever nearing, only moments away. Jasmine spots an open MAINTENANCE ALCOVE deep within the tunnel.  She runs to it, puts Dylan inside and climbs in him. Leaning back out, Jasmine looks for Boomer who stares at wagging his tail.

Boomer, come.  Come boy! Boomer LEAPS inside and Jasmine ducks to the side of the OF DESTRUCTION hits the tunnel entrance, cars are JAMMED TOGETHER, SMASHING into one another. Suddenly the car ARE BLOWN CLEAR THROUGH THE TUNNEL like many toy Hot Wheel cars. Inside the Maintenance alcove, Jasmine shields Dylan and Boomer with her body.

From a distance we WATCH as all of Manhattan is consumed its center outwardly by the growing WALL OF DESTRUCTION. Within seconds all of Manhattan is gone. The WALL OF DESTRUCTION reaches its outer most edges and away. The SCHISM under the craft slowly CLOSES.  The ship now h over a completely wiped out Manhattan.
A hand adjusts the trailer radio.
(filtered)

...reports are unclear as to the extent of the devastation, but from all accounts, Los Angeles, Washington and New York have been left in ruins... Russell shoots a worried look over to Miguel.  Suddenly T moves up to the front on wobbly legs.
Guys, I don't feel so good.
When was the last time you had your medicine?
Four days... five? Troy looks really sick.  Miguel is shocked.
But I gave you some this morning.
I didn't take it.  I thought I didn't need it anymore.
The trailer, with Russell's Bi-wing in tow, pulls over. rushes out, vomiting on the side of the road.  Miguel com his aide.  Russell steps out and walks to the curve in th highway.
Miguel?  Come take a look at this. Reluctantly Miguel leaves his brother's side.
Below an entire valley filled with campers, trailers and busses.  An instant refugee city, if you will, for as far the eye can see.  Spectacular.
Thirty-five pilots are being briefed by their Commanding Office, CAPTAIN WATSON who points to a fuzzy photograph o the craft over Los Angeles.

You will be the first wave in our counter attack.  Though surveillance satellite reconnaissance has been impaired, we have a fix on our primary target. Steve and Jimmy sit next to each other near the back of t room
(whispered)
You won't exactly need radar to find it. Jimmy chuckles.  Watson is annoyed.
You want to add something to this briefing, Lt. Hill? Steve smiles confidently.
Sorry, Sir.  Just real anxious to kick some alien ass. Everyone chuckles, including Captain Watson.

location: EL TORO MARINE CORPS AIR STATION

text: Huge hangar doors open revealing an F/A-18 HORNET, one of U.S.A.F.'s elite.
Thirty F/A-18s await take off on the tarmac as Technician Flight Crews race for position.
The heat waves momentarily obscure our view as the F/A-18 take to the air.
The President is deeply contemplative.  Constance sits do next to him.  She knows what he's thinking.
You saved a lot of lives.
I could have evacuated the cities hours ago. (beat)

You know, when I flew in the Gulf War everything is simple.  We knew what we had to do.  It's not simple anymore, Connie.  A lot of people died today.  How many didn't have to? Constance realizes there's no comforting him.  She suppor him silently by being there.  General Grey comes over.
Any news on my wife?
The helicopter never arrived at Nellis and there's been no radio contact. The news rocks the President.  They both know what that m GENERAL GREY (cont'd)
The fighters are in the air. Whitmore nods and follows the General to the back of the plane.
Military Command has been set up on Air Force One, a kind flying NORAD.  Military and technical crew are seated at controls.  Nimziki is already there.
All satellites, microwave and ground communications with the cities are gone.  We believe we're looking at a total loss. Maintaining his composure, the President looks up at the tracking screens.
Where are they?
(pointing)
ETA with target; four minutes.
Five F/A-18 fighters move into frame.  As we WIDEN we REV total of 30 F/A-18s in attack formation, destination Los Angeles.
Steve pulls a long cigar out of his breast pocket.
(into radio)
Jimmy crack corn, do you have victory dance?
Jimmy pulls his cigar out.  Examines it.
(into radio)
That is an affirmative.  I have victory dance. Mmmmmmm.
(filtered)
Don't get premature on me, Jimmy. We don't light up 'til the Fat Lady sings.
I hear you.
Air sick, David holds a "barf bag" as Moishe talks.
It's Air Force One for crying out loud.  Still he gets sick?
Moishe, please, don't talk. Moishe pats his belly.
Look at me, like a rock.  Good weather, bad, doesn't matter. (motions with his hands)
We can go up and down, back and forth, side to side... David can't take any more of this story and takes off run for the bathroom.
What I say? Constance comes over, sits next to Moishe.
He still gets air sick, huh?  In all of this I didn't get the chance to thank you two.
Think nothing of it, Spanky. Constance smiles, corrects him.
Spunky.  He told you about that?
(nods)
All he could think about was getting to you.  There's still love there I think.
(sadly)
Love was never our problem.
All you need is love.  John Lennon.  Smart man.  Shot in the back, very sad.
In the distance we can see the devastated Los Angeles, th space craft still hovering above it.  The Fighters zoom i frame.
Steve looks down, becomes worried.
I shouldn't have left her.
(filtered)
Don't worry, big guy.  I'm sure she got out of here before it happened. Steve nods absently.
Let's lock and load.
The center F/A-18 on the radar map begins to FLASH yellow just under its image.  We SEE a video display of its FLIR (forward-looking infrared) targeting system, locked on.
Los Angeles attack squadron has AMRAAM missiles locked on target.
Washington and New York squadrons, reporting lock on.
Fire at will.

An Advanced Medium-Range Air-to-Air Missile (AMRAAM) DROP down from the underbelly of the fighter, DARTING OFF. Radar targeted, the missile BANKS hard, adjusting.  We SE is joined by FOURTEEN other missiles, all rocketing towar their target.

The missiles are headed straight for the alien ship. Suddenly about a quarter mile before they reach it, they EXPLODE, as though blown out of the sky. When the smoke clears we see there has been zero damage.
Damn it!
(filtered)
I didn't even see them fire!
Command, Eagle One.  Switching to "sidewinders."  We're moving in.
In unison these amazing birds DIVE together, realigning themselves into six groups of five, spreading out to atta different areas of the ship.
The first attack group, Steve's, are the first to near th colossal alien craft. Simultaneously they drop their AIM- sidewinder missiles.
They reach the same quarter-mile proximity and EXPLODE.
They must have some kind of protective shield surrounding their hull.  Pull up. Most of the fighters do, but one is too late and SMASHES the ship's protective shield.

Steve's squadron BANKS hard, skirting the edge of the shi protective shield. As the fighters approach, the alien ship's enormous ATTAC doors OPEN.  Suddenly DOZENS OF ALIEN ATTACKERS dart out towards our fighters.
(filtered)

Evasive maneuvers!  Check Six! Just moving away in time, our Fighters barely dodge the oncoming enemy Attackers as they FIRE a HAILSTORM of FIRE (tracker bullet-like lasers) showering the sky. As Steve's plane DIVES, an Attacker follows.  Jimmy's pla pulls up behind the attacker.
Jimmy's HUD has the alien attacker in his sights.
(filtered)
Got you covered, Stevie. Jimmy FIRES, another AIM-9 Sidewinder TAKES OFF.
The Sidewinder overtakes the attacker as Steve ROLLS AWAY of position.  Five yards before the sidewinder can get to Attacker, it EXPLODES.
Shit!  They've got shield too.

Banks back around to get a shot.  Just as he turns, three American Fighters are BLOWN TO RIBBONS from Attacker trac fire. The Attackers are in hot pursuit of Jimmy's fighter.  The Fighter flying next to Jimmy is DEMOLISHED.

Jimmy, roll right.  I'll cover. Jimmy's fighter narrowly rolls away from the tracer fire Steve fires another Sidewinder, momentarily distracting t Attacker. Jimmy falls in line with Steve as the attackers turn on t Both fighters jerk downwards at a ninety degree angle at ONE.  Narrowly missing the ground, they bank away.  The Attackers can't follow.
Fighter after fighter begin to disappear from the display screens.
We're losing them.
Then get them out of there. Suddenly one of the large radar display maps FIZZLES OUT.
We've lost the satellite. Before he can adjust, another monitor FIZZLES AWAY.
One by one we SEE the fighters getting TAKEN OUT.  Fireba litter the laser-tracer fire covered skies.

Maybe we can out run them.  Follow my lead. Jimmy and Steve bank away from the craft, hit the supercr BOLTING AWAY at Mach 2. Both  Jimmy and Steve are held tight against their seats, straining against the G-Force. Two Attackers spot them and follow in hot pursuit. Steve and Jimmy are flying at breakneck speeds, the attac slowly gaining on them.
Jimmy, kick it!  They're gaining.
We're already over Mach 2!
So push it! Readouts show the  planes flying beyond measurement.
As the  planes accelerate, Jimmy fights to remain conscio
Stevie... I can't...
Jimmy, stay with me. Jimmy slowly loses consciousness.  His fighter slows, dri off to the right.
gain on them.  One catches up with Jimmy's fighter and FI
Laser-tracers SHOWER the Fighter.  It EXPLODES.  Job done Attacker banks away, returning to Los Angeles.
No!!!! Steve's Attacker stays right with him, slowly gaining.  S kicks his harder, keeping the distance.
A radar OPERATOR spots something on his screens.  He turn Captain Watson.
We have incoming.
Friendly?
I don't think so. Watson hits an alarm which ROARS.
A dozen PILOTS race out onto the field, running for their planes.  Before anyone can reach them, the sky darkens wi ALIEN ATTACKERS who STRAFE the runway.
Through the front glass of the tower we SEE the Attackers firing.  One fires directly at the tower.  Watson DIVES f cover as everything around him erupts into a gigantic FIREBALL.
The entire base goes up in flames.
Steve looks down over the side of his fighter.
Steve HITS THE BRAKES.  Surprised, the Attacker SAILS PAS Taking the moment, Steve DIVES down INTO THE GRAND CANYON
(to himself)

Okay, jerk-off.  Let's have some fun. The Attacker recovers, dives after Steve who flies danger close to the canyon walls.  The Attacker has trouble keep up with him but does. Steve puts on a clinic in advanced aerobatics, banking, diving, swerving. The Attacker seems to be improving, following closer and closer. Steve ducks into smaller canyons, twisting sideways.  Sti the Attacker follows close.
Near empty.  Frustrated, Steve gets pissed.
Damn it! Steve turns down a dead and side canyon.  The Attacker is right on his tail.

Let's see if you're fully equipped. The Fighter is on a collision course with the end of the canyon wall.  Suddenly Steve yanks his ACES II - EJECTION SEAT. Stave SAILS UPWARDS into the air. The Fighter CRASHES into the canyon wall. The Attacker can't turn in time.  He tries to pull up, ov it, just misses the top of the canyon wall. As the nose of the Attacker hits the tip of the canyon wa the Attacker is FLIPPED OVER, ROLLING END OVER END over t top of the canyon. The parachute on Steve's ejection seat pops OPEN.

Rolling end over end, the Attacker is banged up BADLY as finally comes to a stop. Not far away, Steve has a quick, hard, landing.  Rolling Steve quickly pops the buckles on the chute and frees him He stands and looks around.  Spotting the beat up and incapacitated alien Attacker, Steve gets an angry resolve look.  He marches over to the fallen alien Attacker.  He it quickly, spots a type of door that has been knocked aj With all his might, Steve YANKS the door OPEN.

For the first time we get a quick glance at these aliens, odd hybrid creature with fluctuating skeletal structure. The reason we only get a quick glance is because the mome turns woozily towards us, Steve rears back and SLUGS HIM THE FACE, knocking the alien totally unconscious. His anger finally subsiding, exhaustion taking over, Stev stands over the craft, slowly withdrawing the prized Vict Dance cigar.  He lights it and takes a long angry puff.
Now that's a close encounter.

It's dark.  The hole Jasmine had entered is now blocked. pushes but it won't budge.  Exhausted, she ignites her li to get a better look around. As it lights we SEE that we are inside a maintenance gara Jasmine rushes over to a phone but the line is dead.  Tak Dylan by the hand she moves to the large garage doors but can't open them. She turns around and see a large maintenance truck, a hug land-mover shovel attached to the front.  She smiles.

With a ROAR the large door BLAST APART as the maintenance truck SMASHES through.  Once out, Jasmine hits the brakes REVERSE ANGLE - JASMINE'S POV - DEVASTATED L.A. Total devastation.  Remnants of cars and buildings smolde Three scattered survivors crawl from the wreckage.  A nightmare of destruction.  The space craft above, slowly leaving.
Mommy, what happened?
(astonished)
I don't know, badly.
We see dozens of trailers packing up their gear, some alr on the road.  Miguel talks with one of the drivers, then hurries away, running.
Russell wipes down Troy's forehead, he's burning up.  Ali brings over a cold compress.
You know, you're just like your mother.  She was stubborn too.  I had to twist her arm to get her to take her medicine.
I'm sorry, Dad. (beat; scared)
I'm not goin to die like mom, am
You're going to be fine. Miguel comes rushing in, pulls Russell aside.
I couldn't find anything. Everyone is packing up, they're leaving.  Word is a space ship is heading this way.
We should leave too.

There's a group heading south, they said there's a hospital just a couple hours away.  I think we should follow them. Russell nods in agreement.  A knock on the door.  Alicia to find a handsome young boy, PHILIP in the doorway holdi bottle of pills.
Penicillin.  At least it will help keep his fever down.
It's really nice of you to help us.
I wish I could do more but we're moving out.
(too eager)
We're going with you.  I mean, we're going too.
Cool. Alicia nods, smitten.  Philip smiles charmingly and leave
Back in the passenger section, the President sits with Ge Grey and Chief of Staff Nimziki.  The Technician from the command module is briefing them.
They must be targeting our satellites.  We've lost all satellite communication, tracking and mapping.
Have NORAD relay intelligence to our on board computers? The Technician nods and exits.  Defeated, the President s sullenly.
We've moved as many of our forces away from the bases as possible but we've already sustained heavy losses. The President nods his approval absently.  Coming out of bathroom, David overhears.
I spoke with the Joint Chief when they arrived at NORAD.  They agree, we must launch a counter offensive with a full nuclear strike.  Hit 'em with everything we've got.
Above American soil?
If we don't strike soon, there may not be much of an America left to defend. The Technician returns, his face is white with fear.
What's the latest from NORAD?
It's gone, sir.  They've taken out NORAD.
That's impossible...
My God, the Vice President and the  Joint Chiefs...
Mr. President, we must launch.  A delay now would be more costly than when you waited to evacuate the cities! That stings the President.  He considers the option.  Dav shocked.
You can't be seriously considering firing nuclear weapons?
David, don't... David pushes past her.

If you fire nukes, so will the rest of the world.  Do you know what that kind of fall out will do?  How many innocent people... The General gets up running interference.  Constance trie pull David back.
(stern)
Sir, i remind you that you are just a guest here...
(overlapping)
David, please...
This is insanity!  You'll kill us and them at the same time. There'll be nothing left!
(interrupting)
Sit down and shut up! Suddenly Moishe is on his feet, interrupting.
Don't tell him to shut up!  You'd all be dead, were it not for my David.  You didn't do anything to prevent this! As everyone is about to besiege Moishe, the President tri calm him down.
Sir, there wasn't much more we could have done.  We were totally unprepared for this.
Don't give me unprepared!  Since nineteen fifty whatever you guys have had that space ship, the thing you found in New Mexico.
(embarrassed)
Dad, please...

What was it, Roswell?  You had the space ship, the bodies, everything locked up in a bunker, the what is it,  Area fifty one .  That's it! Area fifty one.  You knew and you didn't do nothing! For the first time in along time, President Whitmore smil

Regardless of what the tabloids have said, there were never any space crafts recovered by the government.  Take my word for it, there is no Area 51 and no recovered space ship. Chief of Staff Nimziki suddenly clears his throat.
Uh, excuse me, Mr. President, but that's not entirely accurate. The President and General Grey turn to Nimziki, shocked.
laying across the roadway.  Suddenly SMASH, Jasmine's maintenance truck BLASTS through.

With the massive devastation in the b.g., Jasmine drives maintenance truck down the highway.  In the back, the few survivors she's found. In the back, four INJURED PASSENGERS lay across the flatb a thin, older man, TEDDY tends to them.
Jasmine spots a TALL MAN, his closes in tatters RUNNING d the highway, his arms in the air.
The end has come!  He speaketh his word and the end hast come! Jasmine pulls up along side him.
Hop on.  We're heading out to El Toro.
You cannot defy what has come, it is the end! The tall man moves off, screaming to the heavens.  As Jas watches him drift away she SEES...
Still smoldering from the crash.  A woman can be seen ins still alive.  Jasmine jumps out.
Give me a hand. Teddy joins Jasmine as they pry open the door.  Inside, t pilots have been killed, but Mrs. Whitmore,
lays there in great pain, blood across her blouse.
Let's get her out of here. They erase her from the wreckage, laying her on the ground.  Dylan comes over, standing next to his mother.
She's bleeding pretty bad. Suddenly we
the CLICKING of a rifle COCKING.
Who's got the key? Jasmine turns and see a REDNECK leveling his rifle at her Behind him a small damaged sports car pulls up, packed to gills with stolen, looted appliances.
(yelling to pals)
Looks like I've solved our transportation problem.
Hey, you're welcome to come with us.  We're leaving here anyway...
We're not.  Give me the key. (yelling back)
Get 'em off. Two GUYS rush from their vehicle over to the maintenance truck, pulling the injured off the tailback.
Repent!  Sinners!  Repent!  The end hast come! Running up from behind, the Tall Man comes over screaming The Redneck turns his gun on him.
Back off.  This ain't your business. As the Redneck is distracted, Jasmine spots the bag of fireworks protruding out of Dylan's back pocket.
You cannot go against the word, brother.
Sure I can. The Redneck SHOOTS the Tall Man.  His buddies laugh. REDNECK (cont'd)

Now give me that key, bitch. As he turns back to Jasmine, Boomer starts BARKING wildly Just as he turns to shoot the dog, Jasmine lights a key R from the fireworks bag.  The rocket BLASTS into the Redne his shirt IGNITING ON FIRE. The Redneck drops the rifle, attempting to put out the fl his cronies rush to his aid.  Jasmine picks up the gun, m in on them.
This "bitch" was born in  Alabama with a Daddy who loved to hunt. (cocking the weapon)
So don't think for one second that I don't know how to use this. She FIRES the rifle.  Quickly the rednecks scamper away.

Dragging a heavy bundle wrapped in his parachute, Steve marches across the desert floor.  The alien ARM/TENTACLE dangles out of the parachute. Exhausted, Steve stops to wipe his brow.  He hears someth turns around.
Several hundred of the trailers from the refugee camp are headed en mass towards him.  Smiling, Steve signals them. The trailers pull up on either side, surrounding him.  Mi leans out of his trailer.
(sarcastic)
Need a lift?
When I flew overhead, I saw some kind of base, not far. Confused, Miguel checks his map.
It's not on the map.
Trust me, it's there.
Flying over the desert, Air Force One sails over an immen valley, Area 51 below - hangars, a few buildings, a small strip, not much. Super:  N.I.A. Base - "Area 51", Nevada
Air Force One lands.  Wheels touch down, skid.

The large hangar doors open and Air Force One is rolled inside.  The President and his entourage are met by a contingent of base personnel led by field operative, LT. MITCHELL.  He escorts them to a side hallway.
