Lt. Mitchell walks over to an odd wall switch as the Pres and his entourage wait in the center of the hall.  With a hydraulic HUM, the entire hallway begins to SINK DOWN, an enormous ELEVATOR.
Why the hell wasn't I told about this place?
Two words, Mr. President. Plausible deniability. General Grey shoots Nimziki a pissed off look.  When the elevator stops, a door SLIDES open.
Stepping out of the elevator, they walk into a large stat the art, sterile clean research facility.  It is amazingl well staffed and organized.
I don't understand.  Where did all this come from?  How did this get funded?

You didn't think they actually spent ten thousand dollars for a hammer and thirty thousand for a toilet seat, did you? The President shoots him a look.  They are greeted by a g of SCIENTISTS in whit coats led by, DR. OKUN.
Mr. President, I'd like to introduce you to Dr. Okun.  He's been heading up our research here for the last fifteen years. Dr. Okun is an odd, hyper-energetic man who's spent too m time in isolation.
Mr. President, a real pleasure. They don't let us out much, you you.
(uncomfortable)
Yes.
Well, I guess you'd like to see the big tamale?  Follow me. They walk up a ramp at the end of the room.  Large heavil enforced doors SLIDE open.
The group steps inside and nearly gasps at...
Just like the one that chased Steve.  The entourage stare horror and wonder.  We can SEE the patch-work repairs the made on the ship over the years.
She's a beaut, ain't she? Moishe leans close to David and Constance.
(smug)
Never any space ships recovered by the government, huh?
We've had this for forty years and you don't know anything about them?

Hell no, we know tons about them. The nearest stuff has only happened in the last few days. The President slowly walks around the ship as Okun talks. David, mouth agape, just stares at it. OKUN (cont'd)

See, we can't duplicate their type of power so we've never been able to experiment.  But since these guys started showing up, all the gizmos inside turned on.  The last twenty four hours have been really exciting!
(exploding)
People are dying out there.  I don't think "exciting" is the word I'd choose to describe it! The room goes silent, letting the President blow off stea
(calming)
What can you tell us about the enemy we're facing?
Not all too dissimilar to us. Breathes oxygen, comparable tolerances to heat, cold...probably why they're interested in our planet. (suddenly excited)
Hey, you wanna see them?
The lights slowly TURN ON, illuminated the vault.  Okun l the group to a sealed partition.
This is vault, or as some of us have come to call it, the "freak show." Okun hits a switch and the sealed partition lifts reveali
Three dead aliens float in the milky formaldehyde tanks. murky fluid and condensation obstructs our view.  What we see is not pretty.

When we found them they were wearing bio-mechanical suits. Once we got them off, we were able to learn a great deal about their anatomy; eyes, ears, bipolar digestive system... no vocal cords though.  We're assuming they communicate with each other through other means. David cannot contain his fascination.  He steps forward.
What kind of other means?  Hand signals, body language?
Some kind of extra sensory perception.  Telepathy.
Can they be killed?
These three died in the crash. Their bodies are as frail as our own.  You just have to get past their technology, which is, I'm sorry to say, far more advanced. The President turns to David.
You unlocked a part of that technology.  You cracked their code.
All I did was stumble onto their signal.  I don't know how helpful I can be...
Show them what you've discovered. Work together.  We've got to find a way to beat them.

Four armed GUARDS watch the gate.  An armada of trucks an trailers heads right for them.  They move into position t block their entrance as a blue pick-up skids to a halt be them.  Steve stands up from the back of the pick up.
Sorry, Lt. Colonel, I can't open the gates without clearance.

You want to see my clearance? Impatiently Steve grabs the Guard by the collar, pulling over the side of the truck putting him face to face with bundled parachute in the flatbed.  Steve rips the fabric revealing...
Still unconscious, the alien stirs.  The Guard JUMPS BACK shitting in his pants.  Quickly he signals for the other open the gate. The armada quickly drives past.
Total darkness.  Suddenly light pours in as a  door is op We see the faces of Okun, David and three technicians all peering at us with inquisitive expressions.
See the gizmos flashing?
Sure enough, tons of gizmos with lights flashing.  High t meets organic organisms.  This alien ship looks familiar our own technology and completely different at the same t OKUN (cont'd)

We've been working around the clock trying to get a fix on all this crap.  Some stuff we figured out right away. David climbs in, fascinated.  He touches everything.  Oku points to everything as he describes it. OKUN (cont'd)

This thing we're pretty sure is the life support for the cabin, this do-hickey over here is connected with the engines, this crap...we have no idea what that stuff is for. David is transfixed by it.  He stares at the small screen with flashing light patterns on them. OKUN (cont'd)
But this over here is clearly what they use to navigate and guide the craft. But David still stares at the small screens.
Someone grab my laptop for me? One of the technicians rushes off as Okun leans close.
Find something interesting?
Maybe. The technician hands David his retrieved laptop which he quickly flips open and turns on.
These patterns here, they're repeating sequentially, just like... David turns his laptop around for Okun to see.  The patte David's laptop flashes identically as the alien screen. DAVID (cont'd)
...their countdown signal.  Their using this frequency for computer communications.  It's how they co- ordinate their ships.
You know, you're really starting to make us look bad. The two men exchange a smile.  Another TECHY pops his hea inside.
(out of breath)
They got one!  They got one, alive!
The bundled alien lays on a stretcher that's wheeled quic into the hall.  Okun and his staff surround it.  Trailing behind them is Steve, Russell and Miguel.
How long has it been unconscious?
Excuse me Doctor...
Three hours.
Get him into containment, stat.
My boy is very sick, he needs immediate attention. Okun ignores Russell, hitting the elevator switch on the the room begins its hydraulic HUM.
He's dying out.  I want him sprayed down with saline. Russell SLAMS his fist against the switch, the room stops GRABS a doctor nearby, gets in his face.
My boys is slipping into a diabetic coma.  If you don't do something about it right now he will die. Miguel is surprised and proud of Russell as he holds DOCT ISAACS, meaning business.
O'Haver, Miller, come with me. (to Russell)
Take us to him.

Headlights pierce the darkness as the maintenance truck r to a stop.  Jasmine climbs down out of the truck, her fac ashen. She walks past a sign reading: El Toro Marine Corps Air Station.  Tears begin to roll from her eyes.  We follow h gaze to see...

location: EL TORO MARINE CORPS AIR STATION

text: The entire facility is smoldering, the last remnants of t fire burning itself to extinction.  Jasmine is devastated
General Grey and Nimziki are in a heated argument.
You were the head of the National Intelligence Agency!  You knew all about this.  When were you planning on informing the rest of us!?
It had been deemed classified.

Christ, why didn't you say anything about this when they first arrived?  You could have warned us before we launched a counter attack that cost us hundreds of American pilots! Just then the President enters along with Constance and s other ADVISORS.  He examines a paper map of the United St tacked to the wall, each major city circled in black.
Atlanta, Chicago and Philadelphia, destroyed?
(composing himself)
And there are scattered reports of sightings over Miami, Ft. Worth, And Memphis. The President and his team take seats at the large confer table. GENERAL GREY (cont'd)
We've learned that NATO and western allied installations were the firs to be taken out.  We were next.  They knew exactly where and how to hit us. Grey sneaks an accusatory glare at Nimziki.
And our forces?
We're down to approximately fifteen percent, Sir. (beat)
If you calculate the time it takes them to destroy a city and move on, we're looking at world wide destruction of every major city within the next thirty six hours.
We're being exterminated. The room is quiet.  Constance runs her fingers through he hair.  The door to the room opens and Lt. Mitchell enters Steve.
Mr. President, this is Lt. Colonel Steven Hill. The President quickly gets to his feet, anxiously shaking Steve's hand.
Lieutenant, congratulations.
Thank you, sir.
Where is the prisoner now?
We have him in isolation.  The doctors are very hopeful he will survive.
I'd like to see him.
Yes, sir. The General is concerned but the President is determined. They head for the door.
(to General Grey)
General, I'm anxious to get back to El Toro.
Didn't anyone tell you?  I'm sorry.  El Toro was destroyed in the attack. Steve is shattered, he had no idea.
The injured are gathered around a small camp fire.  Jasmi walks up, dumping a box full of charred can goods.
These should last us a while. As Margaret tries to move, she winces in pain.  Jasmine r to her aid.  The color from her face drained, Margaret lo like she's taking a turn for the worse.
Don't move.  Stay still. Jasmine adjusts the bandages as Margaret turns and see Dy curled up next to Boomer, too adorable.  Slowly he starts wake up.
Your son.
He's my angel.
Was his father stationed here?
He wasn't his father.  I was kinda hoping he'd want the job, though. Jasmine becomes sad, remembering.  Margaret changes the subject.
So, what do yo do for a living?
I'm a dancer.
Really?  Ballet?
(laughs)
No.  Exotic.
Oh.  Sorry.
Don't be.  I'm not.  It's good money. (re: Dylan)
'Side, he's worth it. The bandages changed, Jasmine sits down next to Margaret.
And when the dancing's over?  What about your future?
Funny, it used to scare me when I thought about the future. (looking around)
Guess it doesn't really matter anymore. Dylan comes walking over.
Dylan, come here.  I want you to meet the First Lady.
(surprised)
I thought you didn't recognize me.
Didn't want to say anything.  I voted for the other guy.

Okun and two Medical assistants examine the alien creatur His arms and chest have been strapped down to the examini table. For the first time we get a good look at the head of this creature, long tentacled-type cords interlocked, covering face.  The doctors attach clamps to each of the cords.

Everyone ready? The doctors exchange nervous glances, nod to each other. the same moment all they pull on the clamps, unraveling t interlocked cords.  As the cords unravel, we SEE that thi in fact a bio-mechanical SUIT as we REVEAL...
Beneath the cords lay the unconscious face of the alien, skin translucent, his body fluids, capillaries, muscle ti alien's skin.
Do we have life support monitors recording?
Yes.  If we fuck up it'll all be on tape.
Can we get some ventilation in here?  I can't take this smell.
They've conquered space travel but not b.o. As Okun begins to put on a pair of surgical gloves he sud grabs his forehead.
You all right?
Yeah.  It's just that stink gives me a headache.
He's moving! Instantly everyone's attention is riveted to the arm of t alien as it moves beneath the sheet.  Unseen by the other alien creature's
Another SHARP PAIN hits Okun who SCREAMS, stumbling backw grabbing his head.  The others turn in surprise.
Suddenly SPRINGS up, the restraining straps SNAPPING.  Be Med #2 can react, one of the alien's tentacles SMASHES he across the face.  She is sent sprawling backwards.

Standing before her.  In a wink of an eye, he ATTACKS, le on her. Together they TUMBLE back into a formaldehyde tank.  Hose are ripped from their sides and STEAM pours out.  We get glimpse of their struggle as the steam engulfs them.
Mitchell leads the Presidential party down the hall.  The turn and enter the Medical lab.

The group slows as they enter the room.  They see the containment room through the glass is covered with white steam.  Nothing can be seen.  It's eerily quiet. Cautiously they approach.  Suddenly Okun is SLAMMED AGAIN the glass partition, the creature's tentacles wrapped aro him.  Pressed firmly to the glass, his eyes are shut, his expression pained, but when he speaks the voice is angry.
Release...me.
Open the door.  Get him out of there. Suspicious, General Grey stops him.
Wait. (to Okun)
Can you hear me?

Will kill...release me.  Now! They follow the tentacles with their eyes, up to the ceil of the containment tank.  Suddenly the alien LEAPS DOWN, startling them, landing before them behind the glass. We see he's holding Okun against the glass, speaking THRO HIM.  This is the first real good look we get at the this creature.  Everyone in the room is repulsed and compelled it at the same time.

Through the hundreds of campers and trailers parked outsi Steve runs past until he reaches the open tarmac. A transport helicopter sits on the edge of the landing ar Steve runs up to it and climbs inside.
Steve quickly starts it engines, preparing to take off. SOLDIER rushes over to the cockpit.
(yelling)
What the hell are you doing?  Get out of there!
I'm just going to borrow it. The Soldier pulls out his pistol, taking aim.
No you're not, sir.
You really want to shoot me? Steve stares the Soldier down.  Reluctantly he lowers his
Shit.  I'm gonna catch the hell for this. Steve smiles and gives him a quick salute then TAKES OFF. Quickly the bird RISES UP and darts off into the night.
The President has moved closer to the glass and is talkin with the alien.  The alien uses Okun like a ventriloquist dummy.
Why did you people come here?
Air...water...your "sun."
Where do your people come from? (no answer)
Where is your home?
Here...now.
And before here?
Many worlds...
Can we negotiate a truce?  is there room for co-existance? (no answer)
Can there be peace between us?
Peace?  No peace.
What do you want us to do?
Die. The Alien moves closer to the glass staring at the Presid Suddenly the President clutches his head in pain.
Mr. President?
We kill you...all. The pain becomes more severe and the President SCREAM OUT There is general panic as people rush to the President's
(to Mitchell)
Is that glass bullet proof?
No sir. The General draws his pistol.  Mitchell and the other mil officers follow his lead.  Simultaneously they all begin
The glass SHATTERS into a billion pieces.  The Alien is c ribbons, falling backwards. The President collapses.  So does Okun.  A STAFFER rushes to Okun, checks his pulse.
He's dead. General Grey moves to the President who slowly recovers.
Mr. President, are you okay? Woozily the President sits up, a strange look in his eye.
He wanted me to understand.  He communicated with me. (turning to Grey)

They're like locusts.  They travel from planet to planet, their whole civilization.  After they've consumed every natural resource they move on.  And we're next. The President stands with a new resolve.  He stares at th dead alien on the floor.
(cold)
Prepare a nuclear strike.
The research staff are working near the recovered alien attacker.  Constance comes rushing in.  She looks around David.  Through the glass of one of the offices she sees
Holding a bottle of Jack Daniels, David fishes through a refrigerator as Constance enters.
Just my luck, no ice.
I take it you've heard.
A toast to the end of the world. David toasts her with the bottle, takes a swig.
He didn't come to this decision lightly. David nods, he doesn't want to argue.  He smiles cynicall
You still believe in him.
He's a good man.
Better be.  You left me for him.
I wanted a career.  Didn't you ever want to be part of something special? David stares daggers at her.
was part of something special. Constance realizes he means their marriage.  She's hurt h and can see it.  She turns and leaves.

A black shadow is vaguely seen in the dark night.  As we some moonlit clouds we recognize the shadow is, in fact, STEALTH BOMBER. As we WIDEN, we see that the bomber is part of a squadron eight.  These mighty winged giants fly together in attack formation.
A tracking screen comes to life, eight blips flashing.
We've got the AWAC on line. Signals coming in low. The President's group takes their position behind the technicians.
The eight B-2 Stealth Bombers break formation, each headi off to their different target destinations.
On a large map, we see the eight target destinations and planes heading for them.
Who will we reach first?
Houston, Texas.  Intercept ETA, six minutes and counting down.
Oh my God, Houston.
The major cities have been deserted.  Civilian casualties should be at a minimum, sir. One map screen, ENLARGES, tracking the bomber on route to Houston.
Looters take all they can carry through the broken glass front.  A large heavily armored TANK rolls up front.
Nervous military technicians work equipment as their TANK COMMANDER pulls down a periscope.
Through the periscopes cross-hairs we SEE downtown Housto the City Destroyer space ships settling in above it.
Silhouetted against the shimmering waters on the bay, the Stealth Bomber can be seen as it approaches Houston.
The flight crew works their computers (similar readouts a seen at command center).  The Multi-Function Display (MFD flashing before each crew member.
We have laser targeting locked.
Target is locked, sir.  Do you wish to deploy? Everyone turns to the President who does not answer.
Mr. President, do you wish to deploy. Still there is no answer.
Mr. President?
(softly)
Deploy.
The bay doors open and a large Tactical Nuclear Cruise Mi drops down, flies parallel with the bomber as it adjusts radar and laser tracking.  Suddenly it SHOOTS OFF. The bomber BANKS AWAY.
We see the horizon twisting away as we bank off from targ
She's away.
On the big map we see one FLASHING target line tracking t missile as it approaches Houston.
(to himself)
May our children forgive us.
The Tank Commander readjusts the periscope.
We follow the Cruise Missile as it guides itself on a dir collision course with the space craft.
The targeting map shows how close the missile is, nearly top of the target.  Everyone in the room holds their brea
The nuke speeds closer.  It HITS the protective shield an DETONATES.  A FLASH OF LIGHT.
With the B-2 Stealth Bomber in the foreground, the city b it vanishes in a FLASH OF LIGHT, blinding us.
We can see the extent of the explosion on the targeting m tracking it -- an expanding ring around Houston.
(excited)
It's a hit! The others are still waiting.  The monitor shows the nigh vision picture of the growing MUSHROOM CLOUD rising above city.
The MUSHROOM CLOUD engulfs the horizon.
Rocked by the massive explosion, the shock wave ROCKS the armored tank but doesn't destroy it.
The men inside are KNOCKED around, hard from the explosio
We got the bastards! General Grey shoots Nimziki a look.  The President holds hand, silencing the room.
Can they see it?  Did it destroy the target?
As the cloud begins to dissipate we see THE SPACE CRAFT I STILL THERE, completely unharmed.
Negative.  Target remains.
On the monitors as well, we can see the target remain.  T air is let out of the room, everyone deflated.
Call them back.
The other bombers might have more luck.  We shouldn't just give up...
I said call them back. As the technicians call the bombers away, the President s into a depression.  His last hope of survival gone.

location: EL TORO MARINE CORPS AIR STATION

text: Jasmine keeps Margaret company as the rest sleep around t last flames of their campfire.  From the worried expressi Jasmine's face we can tell that Margaret has gotten worse wounds bleeding badly. A WIND kicks up, the sound of an ENGINE approaching.  Jas squints her eyes looking up into the wind when a BRIGHT L engulfs her.

Bright lights in the sky growing nearer.  Slowly the othe begin to wake up, frightened as the lights INTENSIFY. The others slowly begin to retreat but Jasmine stands, st defiantly.  A smile creeps across her face as she sees th the lights belong to...
The Transport Helicopter touches down and Steve leaps out racing towards Jasmine.  Overwhelmed, Jasmine jumps into arms.
You're late.
You know how I like to make a big entrance. They kiss.
The double doors burst open as the President carrying his young daughter marches through.  Doctor ISAACS comes over them.
How is she?
I'm sorry, Mr. President.  If only we could have gotten to her sooner. The President puts his daughter down as he sees...
Margaret lays in bed, doctors and nurses surrounding her. Patricia rushes over.
She's bleeding internally. There's nothing else we can do. Stunned, the President watches as Patricia hugs her mothe
Hiya Munchkin.
Mommy, we were worried.  We didn't know where you were.
I'm right here, baby. Recovering, the President nods for the doctors to leave t room.  As they begin to march out, he makes his way over his wife and daughter.

Honey, why don't you wait outside so Mommy can get some rest. Patricia kisses her mother, says goodbye and leaves.  Out sight, Margaret winces, fading away.  The President grabs hand for support.  She squeezes tightly.
(through tears)
I'm scared, Tom.
It's okay.  The doctors said you're going to be just fine. Margaret smiles at the man she knows all too well.
Liar. The look between them says more than any words.

The President exits the room, overcome with emotion. Constance, the doctors and some medical crew move to comf him.  He holds them off with a gesture. He looks up and sees Jasmine, Steve and Dylan down the ha He pushes through the crowd and makes his way over to the
I'm so sorry.
I just wanted to thank you. You're a very brave woman. Across the hall, Patricia sits in a chair, waiting.  Whit walks over to her and kneels down next to his small child
Is Mommy sleeping now?
Yes, baby.  Mommy's sleeping.
Topples over with a BANG!  A foot steps in and starts kic trash all over.
David is drunkenly knocking everything over, making a gig mess.  Moishe comes up behind, restraining him.
David, David!  What the hell are you doing!?
I'm making a mess.
This I can see.
We've gotta burn the rain forest, Pops.  Dump toxic waste, pollute the air, rip up the ozone.  Maybe if we screw this planet up enough they won't want it anymore.
David, you're drunk. David slips, falls on his ass, hard.  Moishe helps him ba on his feet.
I think you better sleep this off. Go back inside before you catch a cold. Slowly David looks up towards Moishe, an idea.
Pops, you're a genius!
What'd I say?
A cold?  Of course. Sobered, David jumps kisses his father and bolts inside.
A large crowd has been gathered here at the lab.  General and Nimziki walk up to Constance.
All right, Connie, we're here. What's this all about?
I really have no idea.  He just said to bring everyone down here. Steve shows Dylan the alien space craft.
Does that thing fly in outer space? Steve loos up at the craft admiringly.

It certainly does. When the President enters a technician rushes over and kn on the hatch door on the alien attacker.  The door swings and David climbs down. Grabbing a coke can from the "recycle" trash bin, David p the empty can on top of the alien attacker.  David turns faces the gathering.

Could anyone please step back away from the craft? They do and David nods to a Technician inside the craft. Technician disappears inside, closing the door behind him loud HUM emits from the craft.  David has to yell over it
Lt. Mitchell, would you mind drawing your pistol?
What?

From where you're standing, do you think you could shoot that can off the alien craft? Mitchell shrugs affirmatively.  David gestures for him to Taking aim, Mitchell SHOOTS. The bullet RICOCHETS off the attacker's protective shield Several people in the crowd dock, afraid of being hit by errant bullet.
Sorry 'bout that.  You see, it's protected by the craft's shields. We can't penetrate their defenses.
We know that already.  What's your point? David walks over to his laptop, now connected directly to craft by cables and starts typing furiously.
My point is if we can't beat their defenses, then we must get  around them. David stops typing and stares at his wrist watch, silentl counting down.

Lt. Mitchell, would you please try to shoot it again? Reluctantly Mitchell obliges.  This time the can is BLOWN THE CRAFT.  Everyone in the room is shocked.  The Technic re-opens the craft's door and the loud HUM disappears.
How did you do that?
I gave it a cold. The President is fascinated, he steps closer.  Moishe bea proudly at his smart son.  Constance is amazed. DAVID (cont'd)
More accurately, I gave it a virus.  A computer virus. David turns his laptop around for the President to see.
Are you telling us you can send out a signal that will disable all their shields?

Just as they used our satellites against us, we can use their own signal against them. David walks over to a diagram he's made showing the relationship between the Mother Ship, the Space Crafts an smaller alien attackers. DAVID (cont'd)
If we plant the virus directly into the mother ship, it would then filter down into all the corresponding ships below.
And just how do we infect the "Mother Ship" with a virus? David gestures to the alien attacker behind him.

We'll have to fly their craft out of our atmosphere and dock with the mother ship. Intrigued Steve turns and looks back at the alien attacke sizing it up.  David points to a satellite photo of the underbelly of the Mother Ship. DAVID (cont'd)

We can enter here, upload the virus and set off an explosion that could disable it.  This would disorient the smaller ship below and buy you some time to take them out. Constance reacts, realizing David's participation in the
This is ridiculous.
How long would their shields be down?
Once they discover the virus it could be a matter of minutes.
You want us to co-ordinate a massive world wide counter strike with a window of only a few minutes?
With their shields down it might be possible.
Please, you're not buying into any of this nonsense, are you?  We don't have the manpower or the resources to launch that kind of a campaign. (gesturing to the alien ship)
Not to mention that this whole cockamamie plan is dependent on a machine that no one in the world is qualified to operate.
I wouldn't say that, sir. Everyone turns to Steve who steps through the crowd.
I've seen them in action.  I've watched their maneuvers.  With your permission, sir, I'd like the opportunity to try.
That thing's a wreck.  It crash landed back in the fifties!  We don't even know if it's  capable of flying. David turns to the Technicians.

Remove the clamps! Technicians move to the large holding clamps on either si the craft.  With a loud CLANK, the clamps are pulled away For a moment the hulking craft TEETERS unevenly, but quic stabilizes, FLOATING ABOVE THEM.
Any other questions? Everyone stares at the floating ship with wonder.
Let's do it.
Constance, General Grey and the President are walking dow hall.  Nimziki rushes to catch up.

I understand that you're upset over the death of your wife but that's no excuse for making another fatal mistake... The President whirls, grabs Nimziki and SLAMS him against wall.  Holding him tight, the President gets in his face.
The only mistake I made was appointing a sniveling little weasel like you Chief of Staff. Constance is about to intervene when General Grey stops h PRESIDENT (cont'd)
But this is a mistake, I am thankful to say, I do not have to live with.  Mr. Nimziki, you're fired. The President releases him and turns to General Grey. PRESIDENT (cont'd)
Organize every plane you can find and get some Goddamned pilots to fly them.
Yes, Sir. He storms off leaving everyone stunned.
He can't do that.
(amazed)
He just did.
Four BRITISH AIR PILOTS are gathered around a table going a map.  One pilot, REGINALD, is in charge.

...we've been told that there may be additional re-enforcement in hiding near the Golan Straights... Suddenly the flap to the tent opens.  All the pilots draw their pistols frightening the ARAB PILOT who stands in th doorway.  The Arab Pilot speaks quickly in Arabic.
What the hell's he saying?
(explaining)
Seems they're getting a signal. One Morse code.

As they step out of the tent we SEE more than a HUNDRED FIGHTERS PLANES from different nations parked around them They've all gone into hiding out here in the desert, divi into many smaller camps. Reginald and Thomson follow their Arab cohort, walking th the many other campsites.  Thomson gets some stares from IRAQI PILOTS.
I still get believe this.
The Iraqis don't appear altogether too pleased with this arrangement.
How do you think the Israelis feel? Sure enough a campsite of ISRAELI PILOTS sits very near b
Dozens of Arab pilots are gathered around a large radio a Morse code comes through.  Thomson quickly kneels down, t notes.
It's from the Americans.  They want to organize a counter offensive.
It's about bloody time.  What do they plan to do?
Several Russian Pilots are gathered around a radio, their dozen MIG FIGHTERS standing behind them.
(subtitled)
They claims to be able to bring down their shields.
When do they want to attack?
At the base of a large Volcano in Fuji, several Japanese attack helicopters stand near their pilots, gathered arou radio.
(subtitled)
The attack begins in thirteen hours.

A large world map has been constructed.  Several sites ar marked with stickers reading: COMBAT READY.  Another stic is put onto Mr. Fuji. Striding in, the President surveys the war room.  General rushes over to meet him.
How're we doing?
Better than we thought. General Grey leads the President over to the wall map.
We have confirmed divisions of troops from different armies all around the world.  Most of Europe, the Middle East and Asia are battle ready.
And our troops here?
We've been collecting planes from all over but...
But what, General?
Pilots, sir.  We don't have enough people to get them in the air.
Then find them.
Troy is sleeping peacefully in his bed.  Russell sits at kitchen table as Miguel enters.
How' he doing?

Just fell asleep.  He's gonna be just fine.  Join me in a little celebration? Russell holds up his bottle of Jack Daniels.  Clearly he' been drinking again.  Miguel is crestfallen.  Pissed he t and storms out.
Miguel.  Don't be mad.  Miguel! Drunkenly, Russell chases after him.
Making his way through the campers, Russell SEES a group refugees around some MILITARY OFFICERS who addresses them
(through megaphone)
...We're planning to launch a counter offensive... Russell wanders over towards them. OFFICER (cont'd)

...with our depleted manpower we must ask that anyone with any flight experience come forward. Military training is preferable but anyone who can fly a plane could be useful... Russell pushes his way through the crowd.
(slurred)
I can fly, I mean, I'm a pilot. The officer just stares at the bottle of Jack Daniels sti his hand.
Sorry, sir. Russell gets into his face, desperate.
You don't understand.  I've gotta be part of this.  This is important to me.  They ruined my life.
Why don't you go somewhere and sleep it off. The Officers move on, taking a few volunteers with them. Russell watches them go, dejected.  Angrily, he throws th bottle of Jack, SMASHING it.
A large MISSILE slides back into a LAUNCHER that has been attached to the top of the alien attacker.  Some workers over the patch-work repairs.  Below, Mitchell briefs Stev David.
We've hid the launcher in the ship's manifold. Mitchell takes a small black box from a table near by. MITCHELL (cont'd)
This will be attached to the ships main console.
It's just like an AMRAAM launch pad on the stealths.
Exactly.  Use it the same way. Only the nuke won't detonate on impact.  You'll have another thirty seconds to get as far away as you can.
I'll see how they're doing with the radio transmitter.
(checking his watch)
Oh shit, we're late.
We'll meet you there. Steve dashes off as David moves toward the attacker. Constance has been eavesdropping.  She walks to David.
Thirty seconds?  Isn't that cutting it a little too close?
We'll be well on our way out of there before we shoot that thing off. David leans under the attacker where a TECHNICIAN is atta another device.
It's the strongest SHF transmitter we could get.  It'll tell us when you've uploaded the virus.
Then cross your fingers the shields go down. David turns and walks away, Constance following.
With you?  I don't understand why you can't just show someone how to plant the virus, somebody trained for this kind of mission?
If anything goes wrong I'll have to think quickly, adjust the signal, who knows? David stops, picking up a small trash can labelled "recyc
(smiling)
You know how I'm always trying to save the planet.  This is my chance. David rushes off.  Constance watches him leave.
(to herself)
Now he gets ambitious.
Jasmine is kneeling as Dylan tries to zip up the back of dress.
It's too tight.
I had to borrow it.  I guess that's good enough. Jasmine stands, turns to Dylan.
How do I look? She looks great.  But Dylan only gives her the "so-so" ha gesture.
You're a lot of help. The door behind her flies open and Steve marches in.
You're late.
You know me...
I know, you like to make a big entrance. Steve moves next to Jasmine, takes her hand.
Before we do this, I want you to know I'm sorry.
Sorry for what?
(serious)
I should have done this a long long time ago.
Do you have the ring? As we REVERSE ANGLE we see that we are in a military CHAP large crucifix on the wall.  A CHAPLAIN stands by the alt
You bet. Steve pulls out the famous "dolphin" ring.
Witnesses? Just then the doors open and David and Constance enter ta seats on opposing sides of the aisle.

Then let's get this show on the road. Steve and Jasmine take their places at the altar.  Jasmin radiant.  Dylan rushes up and joins them. As the ceremony begins, David and Constance share a pregn glance.  Slowly they reach across the aisle and hold hand Steve and Jasmine exchange their vows.
Slowly spread apart revealing the myriad of different pla that have been gathered.  Pilots, flights crews and refug prepare for the battle.
Walking out the President scans the motley collection of planes; old, new, high-tech, low-tech.
Beggars can't be choosers, sir. Nodding in agreement, the President walks among the rank file.  Slowly they turn their attention to the President.
Good morning.  In less than one hour planes from here and all around the world will launch the largest aerial battle in the history of mankind... (beat)

Mankind.  The word has new meaning for all of us now.  We are reminded not of our petty differences but of our common interests. Constance, David and Moishe join the group, listening.  E David is moved. PRESIDENT (cont'd)

Perhaps it's fate that today, July the Fourth, we will once again fight for our freedom.  Not from tyranny, persecution or oppression.  But from annihilation.  We're fighting for our right to live, to exit.  From this day on, the fourth day of July will no longer be remembered as an American holiday but as the day that all of mankind declared we will not go quietly into the night.  We will not vanish without a fight.  We will live on.  We will survive. The crowd erupts into applause and cheers.  The President turns and walks over to an Officer holding a bundle of clothes.  General Grey confronts the President as he begi disrobe.
Mr. President, just what do you think you're doing?
I'm a pilot, Will.  This is where I belong. General Grey wants to argue but can't.
Constance and David embrace as Steve turns to Dylan.
When I'm back we'll light those fireworks. Jasmine hugs them both as Moishe walks over to David.
David, take these. David looks down at the "barf bags" in Moishe's hand.
Thanks, Pops.
I want you should know, I'm very proud of you, son. That means more to David than Moishe could have known.
Be careful. Constance hugs David as Steve suddenly freaks out.
Damn it.  We can't go yet.  I gotta find some cigars. Steve is about to bolt when Moishe grabs him, retrieving cigars from his coat pocket.
My last two.  With my blessings.
You're a lifesaver. Steve grabs them and climbs inside.  David smiles awkward then follows Steve.
The hatch shuts and David takes a seat next to Steve who him one of the cigars.
Hang on to this.  For our victory dance.  But not 'til we hear the fat lady sing. Reluctantly David takes it.  As he does Steve notices the "barf bag" on David's lap.  Off Steve's look...
I have a confession to make.  I'm not real big on flying.
Great.
Constance and Jasmine join the others behind the observat glass outside the room as the Attacker prepares for lift Part of the ceiling suddenly PEELS AWAY, revealing an eno SHAFT leading topside.
Strapping in and securing their equipment, Steve grabs ho the throttle.
You ready?  Let' rock and roll. Steve pulls back on the throttle but the attacker swings BACKWARDS.
The Alien Attacker SMASHES BACKWARD into the rear of the Moishe winces as the others react fearfully.
Embarrassed, Steve adjusts the throttle.
Oops. Like a stick shift diagram of a car, a small hand written "post it" card is pasted onto the dash.  Steve reaches ov and turns it upside down, righting the problem.
Let's try that again. This time he pushes the throttle forward and the Attacker JERKS ahead.
Shooting up into the ceiling shaft above, the Attacker ZO out of the underground laboratory.
With a WHOOSH the Alien Attacker ZOOMS out of the undergr shaft and SOARS into the sky.  Once high enough it goes i wild barrel roll.
Just as it comes out of the roll.
What the hell are you doing?
Just getting a feel for her.
The Attacker arcs upward and disappears into the clouds.
The President watches the Attacker flying away.  His cano locks down as he adjusts his helmet.
Grey, you read me?
(filtered)
Roger, Eagle One, our primary target has shifted course.
General Grey is standing by the large map tracking the al ships over the United States.
(filtered)
Where's it headed?
I think our secret is out. They're headed right for us.
(filtered)
ETA thirty six minutes. The President gets a determined look in his eye.  He FIRE his engine.  Following his lead, engines ignite, canopies down and planes taxi to position.
The captured alien attacker soars higher and higher.
Slowly getting sick, David holds onto his "barf bag."
You still with me? David nods sheepishly.  Steve's eyes go wide with wonder the ship climbs to the edge of our atmosphere.
(to himself)

I've waited a long time for this. The ship begins to SHAKE, rattling harshly as it climbs. Through the window we SEE the blue sky EVAPORATE.  Slowly field of STARS take its place. This is the moment Steve had wished for all his life.  He not disappointed.  David, however, is not so thrilled.
Heading further into space, ZOOMING overhead.
Through the windshield we see a huge OBJECT floating in the distance, the moon behind it.
That's it.  Head straight for it. But Steve gets distracted, something wrong with the contr
Something's happening.  It's not responding. David looks over at his laptop, connected to the ship's o board computers.  Th signal is ADJUSTING.
(thrilled)
I was counting on that.  They're bringing us in.
The President's plane leads thirty fighters in attack formation.
We have visual.
The fifteen mile wide space craft peeks over a mountain r headed straight for us.
(filtered)
Do not engage until we've confirmed the package has been delivered.
Roger.
Constance is standing by Lt. Mitchell behind the Military cadre coordinating the battle.
What if that thing gets here before we can plant the virus?
The entire compound is buried deep within the mountain.  It should give us some protection.
But what about all the people outside? Mitchell shoots her a worried look.  Quickly they both da outside.

Steve and David's attacker flies towards the gigantic Mot Ship.  Hundreds of other attackers flow in and out of the Mother Ship through the many triangular portals.  Steve a David's attacker's drawn into one of them.

Caught in a stream of attackers, they flow through the po shaft leading into this planet sized space craft.  They p by enormous windows revealing the HUNDREDS OF ALIENS work within the Mother Ship. We spill out of the shaft and into a gigantic cavity stretching out beyond visibility.  Enormous TOWERS are scattered throughout.
Neither can believe their eyes.  Staring out the front wi they SEES...
Below them THOUSANDS OF ALIENS can be seen as they are ma into dozens of enormous TROOP CONTAINERS docked at the ed of the parade grounds.
Must be thousands of them.  What are they doing?
Looks like they're preparing the invasion.

They pass the parade ground and head into the middle of t huge cavernous sphere, closing in on the many LANDINGS. Hundreds of attackers are docked at each one.
